name: Vibrant Studio in Back Bay by Sonder
summary: At this Sonder, you'll love the stylish, open-concept living area with a comfortable Full-size bed, beautiful natural light, and sleek kitchen with modern appliances. Located in Back Bay, known for its world-class shopping and dining, you'll find beautiful architecture, elegant art galleries, and designer boutiques around every corner.
space: NA
description: At this Sonder, you'll love the stylish, open-concept living area with a comfortable Full-size bed, beautiful natural light, and sleek kitchen with modern appliances. Located in Back Bay, known for its world-class shopping and dining, you'll find beautiful architecture, elegant art galleries, and designer boutiques around every corner. Boston’s Back Bay is known for its lovely rows of Victorian houses, river-side walkways, fashionable shops, and delectable restaurants. Enjoy the historic charm and Paris-inspired landscape built from what use to be a true bay, and is now filled with acres of land and residential neighborhoods. Locals promote an active lifestyle and are often seen jogging along the Charles River Esplanade or indulging in pick-up games during the day. While at night, popular bars and restaurants are quick to fill up along the picturesque tree-lined streets. Your Sonder's keys will be found in a lockbox and we'll be sending you detailed access information three days before
neighborhood_overview: Boston’s Back Bay is known for its lovely rows of Victorian houses, river-side walkways, fashionable shops, and delectable restaurants. Enjoy the historic charm and Paris-inspired landscape built from what use to be a true bay, and is now filled with acres of land and residential neighborhoods. Locals promote an active lifestyle and are often seen jogging along the Charles River Esplanade or indulging in pick-up games during the day. While at night, popular bars and restaurants are quick to fill up along the picturesque tree-lined streets.
notes: Your Sonder's keys will be found in a lockbox and we'll be sending you detailed access information three days before your stay. If you need any help just give us a call. This Sonder is a 2nd floor walk-up with stair access only, and no elevator.
transit: NA
access: NA
interaction: NA
house_rules: House Rules 1. All bookings require a security deposit of $300 or more. You will not be charged for this in advance. 2. Guests can cancel within 24 hours of booking and receive a full refund, or cancel anytime up to seven days before the start of your trip and receive a 50% refund. Trips cancelled fewer than seven days in advance are not eligible for refunds. If you cancel within 24 hours of booking, please reach out to our team, as this refund has to be processed manually.   3. Check-in time is any time after 4 pm. Check-out time is any time before 11 am. You're welcome to request an early check in or late checkout, but this is not guaranteed and we can only confirm 24 hours in advance. 4. We do not allow smoking of any kind, including but not limited to nicotine, tobacco derived products and/or cannabis derived substances; breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine. 5. Most of our locations do not allow pets. 6. Generally, parties or excessive noise are not allowed in our locations. I
host_about: Sonder is reimagining the way people travel. Now in 20+ cities, we’ve been featured in The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, and named 2019’s most innovative hospitality brand by Fast Company. We’ve taken the best parts of home and hotel and combined them into an entirely new experience. All of our spaces are uniquely designed, have 24/7 guest support, and contain all the essentials you need for an impeccable stay. No matter what you’re looking for, there’s a Sonder for you.

name: Amazing Natural Light & Location in Back Bay
summary: Amazing natural light in this centrally-located private bedroom in a quiet, safe neighborhood. The apartment is only a few minutes walk from shopping at the Prudential/Copley/Newbury Street or attending a conference at Hynes Convention Center, Sheraton, Marriott, or other local venues. The apartment has a private patio and full kitchen, and is located right on the orange and green T lines, which can easily take you into downtown Boston, as well as the 1 bus into Cambridge.

name: Luxurious, spacious 3 bdr apartment in Back Bay!

name: Private Room in Back Bay for the Summer!
summary: Are you visiting Boston this summer for vacation? This private room for 1-2 travelers (no children, sorry!) may be perfect for you. The apartment is central to the heart of Boston, and is a short walk away from the Prudential, Newbury St. and the Public Gardens. The space is complete with 1,200 sq. feet of hardwood floor, tall ceilings and natural light. I'm happy to share my favorite eats and drinks, so please reach out with any questions!
space: NA
description: Are you visiting Boston this summer for vacation? This private room for 1-2 travelers (no children, sorry!) may be perfect for you. The apartment is central to the heart of Boston, and is a short walk away from the Prudential, Newbury St. and the Public Gardens. The space is complete with 1,200 sq. feet of hardwood floor, tall ceilings and natural light. I'm happy to share my favorite eats and drinks, so please reach out with any questions! You'll have your own room, but are welcome to use the common spaces as if they are your own! This is a shared apartment space with me! By reserving this private room, you are NOT reserving the entire apartment. Like a hotel, expect shampoo, soap, towels, hair dryer, umbrella, refrigerator, stove, fast internet, fresh linens, etc. Make your request and I'll do my best to accommodate. The apartment is 4 minutes away from the 1 bus and a 8-12 minute walk to three different MBTA train stations.

house_rules: - No high-heels, please! Remember it's hardwood floors in an old brownstone. Heels echo loudly. - Please keep noise to a minimum while walking up/down stairs. The stairs are old, so noise travels quickly and I'm sure you don't want my neighbors to know all about your life. :) - Your reservation is ONLY for you and your guests. If you have other guests, please let me know and we can figure out a solution. - Really, no pets at all. I love animals, but they are absolutely not allowed in the building.
host_about:
30-something working for a marketing firm with a passion for helping those living with debilitating health conditions.

When I'm not working, I'm typically roaming the city soaking up its beauty. Oh, and eating nachos.

Boston’s Back Bay is known for its lovely rows of Victorian houses, river-side walkways, fashionable shops, and delectable restaurants. Enjoy the historic charm and Paris-inspired landscape built from what use to be a true bay, and is now filled with acres of land and residential neighborhoods. Locals promote an active lifestyle and are often seen jogging along the Charles River Esplanade or indulging in pick-up games during the day. While at night, popular bars and restaurants are quick to fill up along the picturesque tree-lined streets. There's limited parking in the area, but there's plen
neighborhood_overview: Boston’s Back Bay is known for its lovely rows of Victorian houses, river-side walkways, fashionable shops, and delectable restaurants. Enjoy the historic charm and Paris-inspired landscape built from what use to be a true bay, and is now filled with acres of land and residential neighborhoods. Locals promote an active lifestyle and are often seen jogging along the Charles River Esplanade or indulging in pick-up games during the day. While at night, popular bars and restaurants are quick to fill up along the picturesque tree-lined streets.
notes: There's limited parking in the area, but there's plenty to discover within walking distance - check out your Neighborhood Guide for suggestions!  Your Sonder's keys will be found in a lockbox and we'll be sending you detailed access information three days before your stay. If you need any help just give us a call. This Sonder is a 3rd floor walk-up with stair access only, and no elevator.
transit: NA
access: NA
interaction: NA
house_rules: House Rules 1. All bookings require a security deposit of $300 or more. You will not be charged for this in advance. 2. Guests can cancel within 24 hours of booking and receive a full refund, or cancel anytime up to seven days before the start of your trip and receive a 50% refund. Trips cancelled fewer than seven days in advance are not eligible for refunds. If you cancel within 24 hours of booking, please reach out to our team, as this refund has to be processed manually.   3. Check-in time is any time after 4 pm. Check-out time is any time before 11 am. You're welcome to request an early check in or late checkout, but this is not guaranteed and we can only confirm 24 hours in advance. 4. We do not allow smoking of any kind, including but not limited to nicotine, tobacco derived products and/or cannabis derived substances; breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine. 5. Most of our locations do not allow pets. 6. Generally, parties or excessive noise are not allowed in our locations. I
host_about: Sonder is reimagining the way people travel. Now in 20+ cities, we’ve been featured in The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, and named 2019’s most innovative hospitality brand by Fast Company. We’ve taken the best parts of home and hotel and combined them into an entirely new experience. All of our spaces are uniquely designed, have 24/7 guest support, and contain all the essentials you need for an impeccable stay. No matter what you’re looking for, there’s a Sonder for you.

name: Unbeatable Two Bed on Garrison Street
summary: Stay Alfred’s latest Boston vacation rental combines the warmth and charm of nineteenth century architecture with twenty-first century amenities. At the crossroads of two historical neighborhoods, you will be a short walk from Back Bay’s fashionable shops and the South End’s hip restaurants and galleries.
space: Featuring a historic brick facade and wrought-iron details, the interior boasts every modern convenience, from a full kitchen to in-unit laundry. The spacious layout and stylish decor make this apartment the ideal place to recharge after a fresh seafood smorgasbord or a rousing Red Sox victory.
description: Stay Alfred’s latest Boston vacation rental combines the warmth and charm of nineteenth century architecture with twenty-first century amenities. At the crossroads of two historical neighborhoods, you will be a short walk from Back Bay’s fashionable shops and the South End’s hip restaurants and galleries. Featuring a historic brick facade and wrought-iron details, the interior boasts every modern convenience, from a full kitchen to in-unit laundry. The spacious layout and stylish decor make this apartment the ideal place to recharge after a fresh seafood smorgasbord or a rousing Red Sox victory. Your historic Garrison Street building embodies the charm and character of Back Bay, featuring a landscaped courtyard and expansive rooftop barbecue area - perfect for grilling up something to accompany your chowdah. We believe in personal space. Prior to your arrival, your unit will be professionally cleaned and your self guided check in process ensures easy arrival with no long lines. Should
neighborhood_overview: An oasis of tranquility and calm among Boston’s busy business center, Back Bay is filled with cozy brownstones and tree-lined streets. This family-friendly neighborhood is a local favorite and is centrally located, so with a plethora of things to do nearby, do you really have to explore any further? Within a mile of Boston Medical Center Boston Public Garden Boston Symphony Hall Charles Playhouse Copley Square Fenway Park Mistral Prudential Center Skywalk Observatory Top of the Hub
notes: You will receive your check in instructions from Stay Alfred via email 3 days prior to arrival. Please contact us directly with any questions. Enjoy your stay!

access: Your historic Garrison Street building embodies the charm and character of Back Bay, featuring a landscaped courtyard and expansive rooftop barbecue area - perfect for grilling up something to accompany your chowdah.
interaction: We believe in personal space. Prior to your arrival, your unit will be professionally cleaned and your self guided check in process ensures easy arrival with no long lines. Should you need us, we’re here 24/7 with our guest services team and local folks on the ground. And if you don’t need us, we’ll stay out of your way. After all, this is your place in the city.
house_rules: 1. You’re living like a local, be respectful of the other locals. We mean, c’mon, how would you feel if your neighbor wasn’t super awesome?  2. All of our Rental Units are smoke-free environments. Even on the balcony, if you have one. We’re super sorry if this is a bummer, but it’s our policy. Hopefully we told you about it ahead of time and you aren’t super surprised that we still mean it.  3. Pets are super awesome, but they aren’t allowed in our Rental Units. However, if your fur kiddo is a service animal or an emotional support animal, give us a call and we will make reasonable efforts to accommodate your needs, as required by law.   4. Your trip details should already be complete. If they aren’t, give us a call ASAP so we can rectify that! What’s a little information between friends?   5. Your friend, your responsibility. Pretty simple, if you invite them to your Rental Unit, you’re responsible for their actions.   6. While watching a million people get out of a clown car is hilar
host_about:
Stay Alfred was created based on the idea of offering short term rentals at an unbelievable price while making the booking process easy and problem free. Stay Alfred acquires properties in high-end buildings and condominiums in the best locations to ensure your stay is satisfying and you want to come back. Since we value your return business, we always offer discounts to those who stay in any of our units time after time. We want you to feel at home when you stay with us and that’s why you will always be greeted with a professionally cleaned unit and quality furnishings. We welcome feedback in any kind of way to ensure we are meeting the needs of everyone!

best,
Jordan Allen
Owner

We cater to:

Urban Vacations
Family Travel
Corporate Housing
Extended stay In Denver, Seattle, and Portland
Insurance and Job Relocation
Events and Weddings 
Military Training and PCS
Government Workers
Pet Friendly Vacationers

summary: Steps away, find world-class dining, shopping and entertainment as well as many of Boston's most prestigious office addresses such as the Prudential Tower, Copley Place and The Hancock Tower. Relish in unmatched skyline views from the 26th floor residents' terrace, or take a breather in the fitness center's tranquil outdoor space. A modern library, coffee bar and retail shops are all on property. Apartment features include high ceilings, oversized windows and Italian inspired finishes.

name: Back Bay, Comm Ave, GREAT location
summary: One bedroom condo in GREAT location on Commonwealth Ave  in brownstone with elevator - walk to Fenway, Berklee, Charles River, MIT and Boston Common. Newbury Street and Prudential are only a few blocks away! At the end of the day sit on the roof deck and look at the beautiful Boston Skyline or take a walk down Commonwealth Mall lighted for the winter. Condo has all the amenities you need including WIFI, TV, and full kitchen. Please note tax of 17.95% is included in our rate
space: Great space all the comforts of home

Condo has all the amenities you need including WIFI, TV, and full kitchen. Please note tax of 17.95% is included in our rate Great space all the comforts of home Shared roof top deck and laundry room are available to you Call us at any time for any issues that pop up and we will resolve it ASAP. please note that one of our reviews shows a cancellation. neighborhood_overview: The Back Bay is the perfect place to make your home base while visiting Boston. Great shopping, restaurants and the Red Sox are at your front door.  We have walked from our condo to the North End enjoying the beautiful streets of the Back Bay, Boston Commons and downtown on our way.  Fenway, Newbury street and the Prudential Center along with Copley Square are all within a 5-15 minute walk.  You could not ask for a better location to explore the city.
notes: Charlie Puth lived in this apartment while he attended Berklee College of Music. We are excited to rent our Boston Condo that we just purchased in April of this year! We have been renting our place on Cape Cod since 2000 and love the idea that people can enjoy our home when we can't.
transit: Parking in Boston can be a problem but you really don't need a car. Boston's T is within 2 blocks of the apartment and will bring you anywhere in the city. Best to find a place to park the car and forget it.
access: Shared roof top deck and laundry room are available to you
interaction: Call us at any time for any issues that pop up and we will resolve it ASAP. please note that one of our reviews shows a cancellation. It was done within 10 hours of booking and we had not realized we had not blocked.  Please feel confident we will not cancel on you.
house_rules: Please leave home manner of which you found it!  Dishes should be washed and trash if overflowing should be put out back
host_about: Semi retired traveling with wife when ever the opportunity arises.

name: Bright 1BR in Back Bay by Sonder
summary: At this Sonder, you'll love the chic, open-concept living area with stunning expansive windows, spacious bedroom with a comfortable Full-size bed, and sleek kitchen with modern appliances. Located in Back Bay, you're a short walk away from an array of fashionable shops, river-side walkways, and delicious restaurants.
space: NA
description: At this Sonder, you'll love the chic, open-concept living area with stunning expansive windows, spacious bedroom with a comfortable Full-size bed, and sleek kitchen with modern appliances. Located in Back Bay, you're a short walk away from an array of fashionable shops, river-side walkways, and delicious restaurants. Boston’s Back Bay is known for its lovely rows of Victorian houses, river-side walkways, fashionable shops, and delectable restaurants. Enjoy the historic charm and Paris-inspired landscape built from what use to be a true bay, and is now filled with acres of land and residential neighborhoods. Locals promote an active lifestyle and are often seen jogging along the Charles River Esplanade or indulging in pick-up games during the day. While at night, popular bars and restaurants are quick to fill up along the picturesque tree-lined streets. Your Sonder's keys will be found in a lockbox and we'll be sending you detailed access information three days before your stay. If you
neighborhood_overview: Boston’s Back Bay is known for its lovely rows of Victorian houses, river-side walkways, fashionable shops, and delectable restaurants. Enjoy the historic charm and Paris-inspired landscape built from what use to be a true bay, and is now filled with acres of land and residential neighborhoods. Locals promote an active lifestyle and are often seen jogging along the Charles River Esplanade or indulging in pick-up games during the day. While at night, popular bars and restaurants are quick to fill up along the picturesque tree-lined streets.
notes: Your Sonder's keys will be found in a lockbox and we'll be sending you detailed access information three days before your stay. If you need any help, just give us a call. This Sonder is a 3rd floor walk-up with stair access only, and no elevator. This Sonder doesn't have laundry facilities. However, South End Laundry and Laundro Magic Coin-Op Laundromat are within walking distance.

access: NA
interaction: NA
house_rules: House Rules 1. All bookings require a security deposit of $300 or more. You will not be charged for this in advance. 2. Guests can cancel within 24 hours of booking and receive a full refund, or cancel anytime up to seven days before the start of your trip and receive a 50% refund. Trips cancelled fewer than seven days in advance are not eligible for refunds. If you cancel within 24 hours of booking, please reach out to our team, as this refund has to be processed manually.   3. Check-in time is any time after 4 pm. Check-out time is any time before 11 am. You're welcome to request an early check in or late checkout, but this is not guaranteed and we can only confirm 24 hours in advance. 4. We do not allow smoking of any kind, including but not limited to nicotine, tobacco derived products and/or cannabis derived substances; breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine. 5. Most of our locations do not allow pets. 6. Generally, parties or excessive noise are not allowed in our locations. I
host_about: Sonder is reimagining the way people travel. Now in 20+ cities, we’ve been featured in The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, and named 2019’s most innovative hospitality brand by Fast Company. We’ve taken the best parts of home and hotel and combined them into an entirely new experience. All of our spaces are uniquely designed, have 24/7 guest support, and contain all the essentials you need for an impeccable stay. No matter what you’re looking for, there’s a Sonder for you.

name: 14 Gloucester 4B by Lyon Apartments
summary: Blending historic architecture and modern amenities, our Back Bay apartments offer the very finest in contemporary, sophistication and elegance in the core of Boston.  Start your day with a Nespresso coffee, then stroll across the Commonwealth Avenue Mall to the Newbury Street shops, Prudential Center and Copley Square.  Each apartment is an impeccable haven from the hubbub of the day-to-day, affording you the finest Boston has to offer.   We offer turn down service for an additional cost so you will never need to do dishes or change sheets when you're on the go. We provide secure mail and package delivery.  Finish the day with casual, or fine dining, all within walking distance of your Boston home. Close proximity to the Financial District, the Charles River, the South End, North End, MGH Hospital and Boston's underground, known as "The T."
space: Gloucester St is a quiet street located in the Heart of the Back Bay. we have used West Elm furniture to furnish this unit with upscale beddings and mattresses. Hardwood floors throughout, freshly-painted 1BD/1BA apartment offers a spacious living room with a decorative fireplace and north-facing windows. Large closet, luxury bed, 40 inch wall mounted tv, wifi, cable tv, Netflix, Xfinity movies, HBO, washer and dryer located in unit. This unit offers turn down service so fresh sheets, trash pick-up, or a meticulous cleaning are all at your fingertips.

name: Classic Style|Central Walking|Back Bay 3BR 1BA #3
summary: This spacious 3rd floor three bedroom unit is characterized by classic Back Bay style and beautiful architectural detail. Among its features are polished hardwood floors, high ceilings and over-sized bay windows that let in great light in both the master bedroom and living area. Nested near the heart of Boston's Back Bay, this is the perfect space for short or long term stays and affords guests quick access to Kenmore/Fenway neighborhood and Cambridge.
space: All bedrooms feature a queen sized bed, nightstand with USB alarm clock, a full dresser and a large closet. The master bedroom also features a private sitting area. The kitchen is fully equipped with every essential food prep. tool as well as pots, pans, serving utensils, glasses and flatware. Within the kitchen there is also a dishwasher, oven, range and refrigerator. The living space has a flat screen smart TV with local channels and HDMI connectivity,as well as a dining table with seating for six.  This unit features standalone central AC and electric baseboard heating.

neighborhood_overview: The Back Bay is perhaps the most sought after neighborhood in all of Boston, both by residents and tourists alike. Access to cafes, restaurants, public transit, parks, the Charles River and our many schools and hospitals is very easy from this location. You can't go wrong here!
notes: All rental units are equipped with wireless internet, irons, ironing boards, hair dryers, coffee makers, toasters, microwaves, linens and towels, as well as a guest book with instructions and recommendations. All building and unit doors are on secure, code-activated locks so coordinating key pick-up and drop-off is not necessary. This unit is accessed using stairs (there is no elevator). The building has a common laundry room that has two sets of washer/dryers which are free of charge to our guests and are available between the hours of 4pm and 11am.
transit: The Boston Common and Public Garden are a 20 minute walk, Fenway Park is 15 minutes, public transit is 7 minutes and grocery, dining and shopping are all within a few minutes walk of the property. You can pick up the Freedom Trail very near the Boston Common. MGH, Boston University, and many other hospitals and schools are within 30 minute walk or a short ride on public transit.
access: All building and unit doors are on secure, code-activated locks so coordinating key pick-up and drop-off is not necessary. This unit is accessed using stairs (there is no elevator) and is a 1st floor walk up. The building has a common laundry room in the basement with a washer/dryer unit that is available for guest use outside the hours of 11 am - 4 pm.
interaction: We have prepared for your stay so that it requires little interaction with us.

name: Big, beautiful studio-like space right in Back Bay
summary: Beautiful, large studio-like space in the heart of Back Bay! Perfect for solo travelers, couples, those visiting Boston for work, etc. Wi-Fi + AC provided. My apartment is just blocks from Bolyston + Newbury St., the Esplanade, Prudential Center and Green Line T stops. All the restaurants, coffee shops, gyms, etc. you could need.  Happy to give you all my best recommendations on where to eat, workout, and visit! No parties or smoking please.
space: The setup of this building is not your standard apartment. You'll be staying on the first floor and will share the kitchen and bathroom with my one roommate. There is no living room or dining room in the building. Instead, my room is extremely spacious with high ceilings and is set up like a studio. I have a bed, pull out couch, and table for eating. You'll also have access to coin washer/dryer in the basement.

neighborhood_overview: It’s easy to understand why the Back Bay is one of the most appealing neighborhoods in America. Unique shops, trendy restaurants, and vintage homes are found on its main streets, including: *Newbury Street *Boylston Street, and *Commonwealth Avenue. *Hynes Convention Center *Charles River *Fenway  *Boston Common  It’s not uncommon to see celebrities walking around these beautiful streets. Even the Back Bay’s buildings are famous. Here you’ll find: *The Prudential Center *The John Hancock Tower *Trinity church, and *The Boston Public Library. *The Back Bay is a protected historic district.
notes: Keep in mind that this is a 110 year old building. :)
transit: The Green line T stop is only a 3 minute walk away, However Uber and Lyft are very reasonably priced methods of transportation as well.
access: Closets and drawers are mainly off limits. The maids sometimes leave the sheets in the washer, so let me know if you need to use the washer/dryer before hand.
interaction: I will be in the city most of the time, and available to assist you in any way I can 24/7, my guests comfort is an upmost priority. If I am out of the city I will make arrangements to insure someone can help you with anything you need.

neighborhood_overview: The unit is located in the heart of Boston's historic tree-line neighborhood known as the Back Bay. Brownstones are typical of this area, and this unit is in this type of building. The unit is only a short walk to Newbury Street, Boston’s most fashionable shopping and café street and only a one-minute walk to the Charles River, with its spectacular sunsets. Baseball fans will be pleased to know that Fenway stadium (with its accompanying range of restaurants and music venues) is less than a 10-minute-walk from the units. Further, just across the river is MIT, with its wealth of events open to the general community. The bus stop for the direct bus to Harvard Square is a few steps from the front door.

neighborhood_overview: You are staying in the St. Botolph neighborhood.  This charming Victorian collection of rowhouses borders the Back Bay, the South End and the Fenway. Walk into the South End and you will find a charming collection of rowhouses with small parks.  The architecture of the area may remind you of London, as the urban design was inspired by the residential districts developed in Mayfair and Notting Hill in the 1850s and 1860s.  There is an array of wonderful restaurants and bars in this area. The Back Bay and its Parisian architecture can be reached by walking north across Huntington Avenue and through the Prudential Center.  The Back Bay was once comprised of tidal flats and, in a massive effort that created more than 450 acres of useable new land, was filled in over the span of about 40 years starting in the 1850s.  Today, the Back Bay is of the most prestigious residential, retail, and office neighborhoods in the City, and offers myriad options for shopping, dining, and sightseeing.
notes: NA
transit: In addition to getting around by walking, Boston city taxis, and Uber, you will be able to use the subway (the “T”) to access other parts of Boston.  Below is a brief summary of the subway lines nearby. Green Line.  Take a left out the front door, walk down Cumberland and take a right on Huntington.  At the next intersection cross West Newton and you will see the entrance to the Green Line station.  This will take you into downtown Boston or the outbound will take you to the Symphony and the Museum of Fine Arts. Orange Line.  Take a left out the front door.  Take another left onto St. Botolph.  Walk until you hit Massachusetts Avenue.  Take a left and you will see the Massachusetts Avenue station of the Orange Line.  This line will take you to Downtown and connects to the Blue Line and the airport as well as the North End and Charlestown.

description: This cozy 1 Bedroom is located in the beautiful St. Botolph neighborhood. The neighborhood lies between the South End and the Back Bay.  This wonderful little apartment is an excellent place from which to explore the city. It is a small but very efficient 1 Bedroom apartment with an additional sleeper sofa in the living space. The building has been fully renovated and is in immaculate condition. While the apartment is a small 1 Bedroom, it is very efficiently laid out.  It provides the essentials to sleep, eat, and bathe; it is an excellent home base from which to explore the city of Boston. The private bedroom contains a Queen bed and the en-suite bathroom.  The common space has a sleeper sofa allowing the apartment to accommodate up to 4 people total. Prior to our guests’ arrival, the apartment is thoroughly cleaned by professional crew and freshly furnished with clean bed linens, bath towels, hand towels, paper towels, toilet paper, soaps, shampoo, and conditioner. We have sought to
neighborhood_overview: You are staying in the St. Botolph neighborhood. This charming Victorian collection of rowhouses borders the Back Bay, the South End and the Fenway. Walk into the South End and you will find a charming collection of rowhouses with small parks. The architecture of the area may remind you of London, as the urban design was inspired by the residential districts developed in Mayfair and Notting Hill in the 1850s and 1860s. There is an array of wonderful restaurants and bars in this area. The Back Bay and its Parisian architecture can be reached by walking north across Huntington Avenue and through the Prudential Center. The Back Bay was once comprised of tidal flats and, in a massive effort that created more than 450 acres of useable new land, was filled in over the span of about 40 years starting in the 1850s. Today, the Back Bay is of the most prestigious residential, retail, and office neighborhoods in the City, and offers myriad options for shopping, dining, and sightseeing.
notes: NA
transit: In addition to getting around by walking, Boston city taxis, and Uber, you will be able to use the subway (the “T”) to access other parts of Boston. Below is a brief summary of the subway lines nearby. Green Line. Take a left out the front door, walk down Cumberland and take a right on Huntington. At the next intersection cross West Newton and you will see the entrance to the Green Line station. This will take you into downtown Boston or the outbound will take you to the Symphony and the Museum of Fine Arts. Orange Line. Take a left out the front door. Take another left onto St. Botolph. Walk until you hit Massachusetts Avenue. Take a left and you will see the Massachusetts Avenue station of the Orange Line. This line will take you to Downtown and connects to the Blue Line and the airport as well as the North End and Charlestown.

description: At this Sonder, you'll love the comfortable living area, charming bedrooms and playful decor. This apartment is in Back Bay, known for its fashionable shops and is close to the Hynes Convention Center T Station. Boston’s Back Bay is known for its lovely rows of Victorian houses, river-side walkways, fashionable shops, and delectable restaurants. Enjoy the historic charm and Paris-inspired landscape built from what use to be a true bay, and is now filled with acres of land and residential neighborhoods. Locals promote an active lifestyle and are often seen jogging along the Charles River Esplanade or indulging in pick-up games during the day. While at night, popular bars and restaurants are quick to fill up along the picturesque tree-lined streets. Your Sonder's keys will be found in a lockbox and we'll be sending you detailed access information three days before your stay. If you need any help just give us a call. house_rules: - Please don't wear shoes in the house - No loud music after 10pm -Do not flush anything down the toilet unless you have eaten it first (besides toilet paper of course). No feminine products, paper towels, tissues, or anything else please. Clogs that require a plumber are at the cost of the guest. - Neighbors take note, so again, if you are thinking of having a party, loud music, a get together of any kind here, please rent somewhere else because you will be caught and violation of this policy will result in automatic forfeiture of your security deposit (plus any additional damages). - No smoking in the home, directly in front, or on the roof deck. That includes smokeless and vaporizers. Evidence of smoking will result in a $750 fine to your security deposit, so please just go outside the house!

name: 14 Gloucester St #2B By Lyon Apartments
summary: Blending historic architecture and modern amenities, our Back Bay apartments offer the very finest in contemporary, sophistication and elegance in the core of Boston.  Start your day with a Nespresso coffee, then stroll across the Commonwealth Avenue Mall to the Newbury Street shops, Prudential Center and Copley Square.  Each apartment is an impeccable haven from the hubbub of the day-to-day, affording you the finest Boston has to offer.   We offer turn down service for an additional cost so you will never need to do dishes or change sheets when you're on the go. We provide secure mail and package delivery.  Finish the day with casual, or fine dining, all within walking distance of your Boston home. Close proximity to the Financial District, the Charles River, the South End, North End, MGH Hospital and Boston's underground, known as "The T."
space: Gloucester St is a quiet street located in the Heart of the Back Bay. we have used West Elm furniture to furnish this unit with upscale beddings and mattresses. Hardwood floors throughout, freshly-painted 1BD/1BA apartment offers a spacious living room with a decorative fireplace and north-facing windows. Large closet, luxury bed, 40 inch wall mounted tv, wifi, cable tv, Netflix, Xfinity movies, HBO, washer and dryer located in unit. This unit offers turn down service so fresh sheets, trash pick-up, or a meticulous cleaning are all at your fingertips.

name: Gorgeous Apartment | Unbeatable Location
summary: Hi! Thanks for taking the time to check out my listing! This is a unique space unlike any other in Boston, the building used to be a Michelin stared French restaurant before it was transformed into this gorgeous apartment.  The location is simply unbeatable for any Boston activities! (business or pleasure). You can see Newbury St. from the living room window, Hynes convention center/Prudential Mall only 2 blocks away. This property is ONE OF A KIND!
space: The apartment is located on the second floor of a 122 year old brown-stone in the heart of the Historic Back Bay district. The living room is completely made of high end mix of mahogany and oak. There was meticulous carpentry and craftsmanship work that made that room what it is, there is a rollaway 55" LED TV that can be placed at any desirable angle in the room (or the apartment). The leaving room has a pleasant vibe for getting together and hanging out. In the guest bathroom you can see a full wallpaper map of old Paris, next is the full bath next to the kitchen with Gas range and oven, and ice-maker. Three bedrooms, the Master bedroom comes with its own private bath. The apartment has high-speed wifi, across 2 networks to reach all parts of the apartment.

Back Bay is most famous for its rows of Victorian brownstone homes — considered one of the best preserved examples of 19th-century urban design in the United States — as well as numerous architecturally signif
neighborhood_overview: Back Bay is most famous for its rows of Victorian brownstone homes — considered one of the best preserved examples of 19th-century urban design in the United States — as well as numerous architecturally significant individual buildings, and cultural institutions such as the Boston Public Library. It is also a fashionable shopping destination (especially Newbury and Boylston Streets, and the adjacent Prudential Center and Copley Place malls) and home to some of Boston's tallest office buildings, the Hynes Convention Center, and numerous major hotels. Coffee: Great place to start your day - about 5 mins walk from Apartment. notes: •	No smoking inside the apartment, but smoking outside the building is OK. •	No parties. This is a beautiful, quiet part of the world, so please be respectful towards the neighbors and keep the noise down, especially between 10 pm and 7 am. •	If garbage is full please tie bag securely closed  and set it aside in the corner or take it out to bin at side of house. Please place a new bag in the black bin if needed. Most importantly Enjoy your stay - And do not hesitate to ping us if you have any questions.

name: Lavish 1-BR near Fenway Park + Great Amenities!!
summary: Superior features including designer kitchens, generous closets and fireplaces enhance these apartment homes.  Landscaped gardens & a private courtyard with elegant cast iron fountains, a roof top terrace with skyline views and concierge services are some of the upscale amenities offered at this luxurious community. These apartments are located at the crossroads of Boston’s historic Back Bay and South End neighborhoods and only a short walk from Back Bay's fashionable shops & hip restaurants.
space: 1 BED 1 BATH SLEEPS 3 The building’s historic 19th century façade, its 21st century amenities, intimate courtyard, and landscaped gardens, is truly a home away from home for the most refined traveler. At the crossroads of two of Boston’s most historically preserved neighborhoods, Back Bay and South End, you are a short walk to high-end shopping, trendy restaurants, art galleries, museums, and Fenway Park. These luxury apartments allow you all the conveniences that come with living in downtown Boston without all the hustle and bustle of city life. Our 24 hour customer service, concierge service, controlled-access parking and your proximity to the T’s Orange and Green lines makes this the only place to stay on your next trip to Boston!

name: Location!  Deck & Parking For Rent, Sleeps 4
summary: Boston at its finest! Exquisitely decorated, sun drenched large one bedroom apartment in historic downtown pocket neighborhood of Bay Village. Steps to the Theatre District including Charles Play House, Wilbur Theatre, and City Performing Arts Center.  5 minute walk to NE Medical/Tufts subway stop, 10 minute walk to Whole Foods grocery and a stones throw away from shopping at Copley Square. We're in the center of downtown Boston, three miles from the airport.  We look forward to hosting you.
space: Newly renovated and beautifully furnished one bedroom apartment. You'll enjoy your early morning coffee on the private deck. Luxurious marble and granite  bathroom, bedroom boasts a queen size bed with a brand new memory foam mattress. The living room has a dining area, large flat screen TV and a sofa that pulls out to become a queen size bed. Cable and high speed wifi provided. You can make a home cooked meal in our renovated kitchen AND we have a parking spot for rent! Heat: we set the temperature controls to 74F; down to 68F at night. (if you're not familiar, 65-68 is average). If 74F during the day is not warm enough for you, talk to us about it. If it's raised above that, there may be an additional fee.

neighborhood_overview: Our apartment is located in the Bay Village neighborhood of Boston. It is nestled between Back Bay, the South End, and the Theatre District which make it the perfect spot for any traveler. Bay Village, known for its fabulous location and local charm, is steps from public transportation and near many wonderful restaurants and cafes.  Tufts Medical subway stop (orange line) is a 5 minute walk 7 minute walk to Arlington St subway (green line) 10 minute walk to Whole Foods grocery store CVS Pharmacy is a 5 minute walk.  Coffee and amazing breakfast sandwiches a 1 minute walk down the street to the very popular Mike and Patty's. Try Erbaluce, 2 minute walk for upscale Italian dining.
notes: When booking, please tell us about yourself and what brings you to Boston. We ask that you have finished the Airbnb verification process by verifying one social media account and scanning your offline ID. Go to www.airbnb.com/verify for more info. Heat: we set the temperature controls to 74F; down to 68F at night. (if you're not familiar, 65-68 is average). If 74F during the day is not warm enough for you, talk to us about it. If it's raised above that, there may be an additional fee. When booking, please tell us about yourself and what brings you to Boston. We ask that you have finished the Airbnb verification process by verifying one social media account and scanning your offline ID. Go to www.airbnb.com/verify for more info. Check in is at 3PM and check out is by 11AM. Please alert us of your planned arrival and departure time at least 24 hours ahead of time. We cannot offer early/late check ins or space to store your bags. Please ask about storage solutions in Boston!
transit: Parking! A rarity here but we have it. Please inquire.  Subway - the orange line at Tufts is a 6-7 minute walk away. Ten minute walk to the green line at Arlington St/Boylston or Copley.
access: You'll have full access to your home away from home, which is stocked with essential toiletries, towels and linens. An iron, ironing board, and hair dryer are also available for your use
interaction: We are always available by cell phone in case of emergencies. We are great at giving local directions and suggestions on things to do in the area. If our paths cross, terrific, otherwise we'll leave you to your privacy knowing we are only a call or text away.

name: Modern one bedroom condo in the heart of Back Bay
summary: Stay in the heart of the desirable Back Bay neighborhood of Boston, and enjoy the charm of this historical city from a modern and efficiently laid out one bedroom condominium.
space: Our modern one bedroom condo is located on the lower level of a well maintained building - with just one flight of stairs down to the unit. It is equipped with a queen size bed, fold-out sofa, modern and fully equipped kitchen, bath with tub, and plenty of windows and light for a lower level condo.
description: Stay in the heart of the desirable Back Bay neighborhood of Boston, and enjoy the charm of this historical city from a modern and efficiently laid out one bedroom condominium. Our modern one bedroom condo is located on the lower level of a well maintained building - with just one flight of stairs down to the unit. It is equipped with a queen size bed, fold-out sofa, modern and fully equipped kitchen, bath with tub, and plenty of windows and light for a lower level condo. The condo and its contents are yours for your stay. We just ask that you please care for it as if it were your own. Our manager will be happy to help show you around the condo, answer any questions before/during/or after your stay, and with any special requests you might have. Back Bay is considered one of the premiere places to be in Boston, and our street is particularly well situated between the famed Newbury Street and the beautiful Charles River. Copley Station (Green Line MBTA) is located just a couple of blocks

transit: Copley Station (Green Line MBTA) is located just a couple of blocks from our condo. We would recommend ditching the car while staying here, and enjoying Boston on foot from this central location. You can easily walk to most tourist attractions in the city, but we can also recommend Uber/Lyft for local transportation. If you're feeling more adventurous, you can also rent a Hubway bike from a nearby street and ride the bike lanes around the city.

host_about:
Welcome to our profile, and allow us to introduce ourselves! For over twenty years, Maverick Suites has been providing boutique furnished apartments amongst brownstones all over Boston! We know the magic of this city, and love being a short-term stay for travelers from all across the globe. For the past three years, we have offered 80 of our units to Airbnb adventurers, and have had well-over thousands of stays! With studios across the city, stay on Newbury Street, the South End, Beacon Hill or Coolidge Corner depending on your travel plans.

Fueled by native, passionate team members, our team is here to provide an affordable and accommodating stay every time. Abbi, Mohammed, and Andrea are here to help answer any question or concern within minutes! Sometimes, you just can't get the AC to turn on. We get it. Every issue, every question, every restaurant recommendation (we have plenty), we want to assist you!

Sincerely,
The Cool Neighbors (Maverick Suites)

house_rules: 1. You’re living like a local, be respectful of the other locals. We mean, c’mon, how would you feel if your neighbor wasn’t super awesome?  2. All of our Rental Units are smoke-free environments. Even on the balcony, if you have one. We’re super sorry if this is a bummer, but it’s our policy. Hopefully we told you about it ahead of time and you aren’t super surprised that we still mean it.  3. Pets are super awesome, but they aren’t allowed in our Rental Units. However, if your fur kiddo is a service animal or an emotional support animal, give us a call and we will make reasonable efforts to accommodate your needs, as required by law.   4. Your trip details should already be complete. If they aren’t, give us a call ASAP so we can rectify that! What’s a little information between friends?   5. Your friend, your responsibility. Pretty simple, if you invite them to your Rental Unit, you’re responsible for their actions.   6. While watching a million people get out of a clown car is hilar

Jordan Allen

transit: The apartment location makes it easily accessible by train, car, bus, and plane: VIA Amtrak 1-2 minutes away from Back Bay station, where trains to and from New York, Philadelphia, and Washington DC depart and arrive. VIA Subway (The T) Boston's subway system, called the T by locals, has two stations in very close proximity: From Back Bay station (1-2 min walking distance) you can take the Orange line, which goes from Jamaica Plains all the way through downtown Boston and then through Cambridge to the Assembly Outlet Mall From Arlington station (1-2 min walking distance) you can take the Green line, which can take you anywhere from Somerville/Kendall Square to Northeastern University, Boston College, and Boston University.  VIA Car There are several paid covered parking garages within walking distance (1 min and 3 min walking distance) VIA Plane The Logan Express, a convenient direct bus shuttle to and from Logan Airport (all terminals), stops in Copley Square, only 2 minutes walking d
access: Other than their private bedroom and bathroom, guests are welcome to use the kitchen at their leisure, as well as the common space in the living room (10 person table, couch, TV, etc.)
interaction: You'll be sharing the apartment with me, and while I will not always be present to welcome you, I will always be available via e-mail, phone, and text (preferred during work hours, 9 A.M. - 5 P.M.) should any unforeseen issues arise.  I spend most weekdays in the office; sometimes I travel for work, and sometimes I work from home.

host_about:

name: Wondrous Back Bay Condo!
summary: Stay Alfred’s latest Boston vacation rental combines the warmth and charm of nineteenth century architecture with twenty-first century amenities. At the crossroads of two historical neighborhoods, you will be a short walk from Back Bay’s fashionable shops and the South End’s hip restaurants and galleries.
space: Featuring a historic brick facade and wrought-iron details, the interior boasts every modern convenience, from a full kitchen to in-unit laundry. The spacious layout and stylish decor make this apartment the ideal place to recharge after a fresh seafood smorgasbord or a rousing Red Sox victory.
description: Stay Alfred’s latest Boston vacation rental combines the warmth and charm of nineteenth century architecture with twenty-first century amenities. neighborhood_overview: An oasis of tranquility and calm among Boston’s busy business center, Back Bay is filled with cozy brownstones and tree-lined streets. This family-friendly neighborhood is a local favorite and is centrally located, so with a plethora of things to do nearby, do you really have to explore any further? Within a mile of Boston Medical Center Boston Public Garden Boston Symphony Hall Charles Playhouse Copley Square Fenway Park Mistral Prudential Center Skywalk Observatory Top of the Hub
notes: You will receive your check in instructions from Stay Alfred via email 3 days prior to arrival. Please contact us directly with any questions. Enjoy your stay!

access: Your historic Garrison Street building embodies the charm and character of Back Bay, featuring a landscaped courtyard and expansive rooftop barbecue area - perfect for grilling up something to accompany your chowdah.
interaction: We believe in personal space. Prior to your arrival, your unit will be professionally cleaned and your self guided check in process ensures easy arrival with no long lines. Should you need us, we’re here 24/7 with our guest services team and local folks on the ground. And if you don’t need us, we’ll stay out of your way. After all, this is your place in the city.
house_rules: 1. You’re living like a local, be respectful of the other locals. We mean, c’mon, how would you feel if your neighbor wasn’t super awesome?  2. All of our Rental Units are smoke-free environments. Even on the balcony, if you have one. We’re super sorry if this is a bummer, but it’s our policy. Hopefully we told you about it ahead of time and you aren’t super surprised that we still mean it.  3. Pets are super awesome, but they aren’t allowed in our Rental Units. However, if your fur kiddo is a service animal or an emotional support animal, give us a call and we will make reasonable efforts to accommodate your needs, as required by law.   4. Your trip details should already be complete. If they aren’t, give us a call ASAP so we can rectify that! What’s a little information between friends?   5. Your friend, your responsibility. Pretty simple, if you invite them to your Rental Unit, you’re responsible for their actions.   6. While watching a million people get out of a clown car is hilar
host_about:
Stay Alfred was created based on the idea of offering short term rentals at an unbelievable price while making the booking process easy and problem free. Stay Alfred acquires properties in high-end buildings and condominiums in the best locations to ensure your stay is satisfying and you want to come back. Since we value your return business, we always offer discounts to those who stay in any of our units time after time. We want you to feel at home when you stay with us and that’s why you will always be greeted with a professionally cleaned unit and quality furnishings. We welcome feedback in any kind of way to ensure we are meeting the needs of everyone!

best,
Jordan Allen
Owner

notes: There is metered street parking. There is also parking available at 149 Newbury Street Parking. You can reach them with the information provided here: (URL HIDDEN) Newbury Street and Boylston Street have metered parking. Sidestreet are resident parking after 6pm (except Sundays). Not suitable for small children. Not suitable for people with disability, there are stairs that needs to be climb down from the front entrance, the back entrance only requires 3 steps to be walked down.
transit: Less than 5 minutes walk to MBTA Train station (Hynes and Copley station) and shopping areas along Boylston and Newbury Street.  Enjoy luxury shopping, bars and restaurants along Newbury street Other key attractions nearby include: - Prudential Center, Top of the Hub Restaurant (2 mins walk) - Trinity Church ( 7 mins walk) - Boston Common ( 15 mins walk) - Berklee Music of School (10 mins walk) - Supermarkets (Star Market, Trader Joes, Whole Foods within 5-10 mins walk) - Boston Symphony Hall (10 mins walk) - MIT, Boston University, Northeastern University (20 - 30 mins walk) - Chinatown (30 mins walk)  - Uber and Lyft accessible
access: The guest has access to the entire apartment. The apartment is private to you and will only be accessed by you during your stay. No guests. Kitchen, living room, bedroom, bedroom closet, bathroom, coin-operated laundry.
interaction: Happy to provide tips and suggestions as you plan your trip, and if you have any questions during your stay please send requests via Airbnb messaging.
house_rules: - No smoking - No parties, events, loud music or loud noise. - No pets - Self check-in with lockbox - Check in is anytime after 2PM - Check out by 10AM - No free parking available - Coming through front entrance will require going down 1 flight of stairs and leaving through front entrance will require going up 1 flight of stairs.  - Entering and exiting through private entrance does not require climbing stairs.
host_about: I'm originally from Boston. I love movies, traveling, swimming, shooting pool, bowling, ping-pong, football, roller coasters/theme parks, skiing, and hiking! I love the movie The Shawshank Redemption. I like to listen to classic rock mostly Guns N' Roses, Led Zeppelin, The Beatles and The Animals. I'm an American at heart but my taste buds favor food from Thailand. I love new life experiences, stepping out of my comfort zone, being a good friend, entertaining others and showing people a good time. My life motto is, "Everything in moderation". I'm 29 years old, ambitious and full of life! Here to make your Boston stay, the best stay possible! Always available to give great travel advice, restaurant and night life suggestions or help out with any other questions or concerns that may arise regarding maintenance and repairs. On the Airbnb Messenger you'll be speaking with myself. In the event of an emergency I can be reached by phone via text message or phone call. Come visit our Strong city of Boston! Home Sweet Home, professionally managed for an amazing experience and memorable visit, vacation or tour of Boston!

description: At this Sonder, you'll love the bright and inviting living area with incredible natural light, modern decor with stylish details, and sleek fully-equipped kitchen with modern appliances. Located in Back Bay, known for its world-class shopping and dining, you'll find beautiful architecture, elegant art galleries, and designer boutiques around every corner. Boston’s Back Bay is known for its lovely rows of Victorian houses, river-side walkways, fashionable shops, and delectable restaurants. Enjoy the historic charm and Paris-inspired landscape built from what use to be a true bay, and is now filled with acres of land and residential neighborhoods. Locals promote an active lifestyle and are often seen jogging along the Charles River Esplanade or indulging in pick-up games during the day. While at night, popular bars and restaurants are quick to fill up along the picturesque tree-lined streets. Guests can cancel within 24 hours of booking and receive a full refund, or cancel anytime up to seven days before the start of your trip and receive a 50% refund. Trips cancelled fewer than seven days in advance are not eligible for refunds. host_about: Sonder is reimagining the way people travel. Now in 20+ cities, we’ve been featured in The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, and named 2019’s most innovative hospitality brand by Fast Company. We’ve taken the best parts of home and hotel and combined them into an entirely new experience. All of our spaces are uniquely designed, have 24/7 guest support, and contain all the essentials you need for an impeccable stay. No matter what you’re looking for, there’s a Sonder for you.

name: Boston Roots|Marlborough 1BR 1BA #2
summary: Marlborough Street is a quaint, tree-lined street in perhaps the most sought after neighborhood in all of Boston, the Back Bay. This apartment has 1 bedroom, a with queen-sized bed, 1 bathroom, modern fully stocked eat-in kitchen and full-sized living room, free wi-fi and lots of space. The building has a common laundry room for guests. This unit is on the third floor and only accessed by stairs, no elevator.
space: The first floor one bedroom suite features a large, open kitchen, living and dining room. There is an original mantle surrounding the ornamental fireplace in the living room and polished hardwood floors run throughout the unit. The bedroom features a queen mattress set, ceiling fan, nightstand, reading lamp and alarm clock. The bathroom is equipped with a shower. The kitchen is fully equipped with pots, pans and cooking utensils, along with dishwasher, oven, range and refrigerator and there is a dining table that seats four people. The living room has a 32” flat screen TV with local channels and the sofa pulls out to a queen bed which makes this the perfect unit for two or four people. During the warm months a window air conditioning unit keeps this unit cool.

The building has a common laundry room for guests. This unit is on the third floor and only accessed by stairs, no elevator. The first floor one bedroom suite features a large, open kitchen, living and dining room. The kitchen is fully equipped with pots, pans and cooking utensils, along with dishwasher, oven, range and refrigerator and there is a dining table that seats four people. The living room has a 32” flat screen TV with loc
neighborhood_overview: The Back Bay is perhaps the most sought after neighborhood in all of Boston, both by residents and tourists alike. Access to cafes, restaurants, public transit, parks, the Charles River and our many schools and hospitals is very easy from this location. You can't go wrong here!
notes: All rental units are equipped with wireless internet, irons, ironing boards, hair dryers, coffee makers, toasters, microwaves, linens and towels, as well as a guest book with instructions and recommendations. All building and unit doors are on secure, code-activated locks so coordinating key pick-up and drop-off is not necessary. This unit is accessed using stairs (there is no elevator). The building has a common laundry room that has two sets of washer/dryers which are free of charge to our guests and are available between the hours of 4pm and 11am.
transit: We're 4 blocks from the nearest subway and bus station, which can take you almost anywhere in Boston. It's also very easy to get around on foot from this location. We recommend not bringing a car, but we do have parking available behind the building for a fee if you decide you can't do without one.
access: Access is via code activated doors. Once you have a confirmed reservation you will receive an email from our management company confirming the details of your stay and the exact process to access the building and the unit.
interaction: We have prepared for your stay so that you don't need to interact with us at all during your time here. You have complete privacy.
house_rules: NA
host_about: Husband, father, friend and real estate enthusiast. Long time Airbnb host and traveller. Small business owner and operator. Interests include food and drink, sports and nutrition, golf, anything Italy, joking around and having fun and anything that fits in to those categories!

name: Back Bay Brownstone Oasis|1BR 1BA #5
summary: Marlborough Street is a quaint, tree-lined street in perhaps the most sought after neighborhood in all of Boston, the Back Bay. This apartment has 2 bedrooms, all with queen-sized beds, 1 bathroom, modern fully stocked eat-in kitchen and full-sized living room, free wi-fi and lots of space. The building has a common laundry room for guests. This unit is on the third floor and only accessed by stairs, no elevator.
space: The second floor one bedroom suite features a large, open kitchen, living and dining room. There is an original mantle surrounding the ornamental fireplace in the living room and polished hardwood floors run throughout the unit. The bedroom features a queen mattress set, ceiling fan, nightstand, reading lamp and alarm clock. The bathroom is equipped with a shower. The kitchen is fully equipped with pots, pans and cooking utensils, along with dishwasher, oven, range and refrigerator and there is a dining table that seats four people. The living room has a 32” flat screen TV with local channels and the sofa pulls out to a queen bed which makes this the perfect unit for two or four people. During the warm months a window air conditioning unit keeps this unit cool.

The living room has a 32” flat screen TV wit
neighborhood_overview: The Back Bay is perhaps the most sought after neighborhood in all of Boston, both by residents and tourists alike. Access to cafes, restaurants, public transit, parks, the Charles River and our many schools and hospitals is very easy from this location. You can't go wrong here!
notes: All rental units are equipped with wireless internet, irons, ironing boards, hair dryers, coffee makers, toasters, microwaves, linens and towels, as well as a guest book with instructions and recommendations. All building and unit doors are on secure, code-activated locks so coordinating key pick-up and drop-off is not necessary. This unit is accessed using stairs (there is no elevator). The building has a common laundry room that has two sets of washer/dryers which are free of charge to our guests and are available between the hours of 4pm and 11am.
transit: We're 4 blocks from the nearest subway and bus station, which can take you almost anywhere in Boston. It's also very easy to get around on foot from this location. We recommend not bringing a car, but we do have parking available behind the building for a fee if you decide you can't do without one.
access: Access is via code activated doors. Once you have a confirmed reservation you will receive an email from our management company confirming the details of your stay and the exact process to access the building and the unit.
interaction: We have prepared for your stay so that you don't need to interact with us at all during your time here. You have complete privacy.

host_about: Husband, father, friend and real estate enthusiast. Long time Airbnb host and traveller. Small business owner and operator. Interests include food and drink, sports and nutrition, golf, anything Italy, joking around and having fun and anything that fits in to those categories!

name: 14 Gloucester 1A by Lyon Apartments
summary: Blending historic architecture and modern amenities, our Back Bay apartments offer the very finest in contemporary, sophistication and elegance in the core of Boston. Start your day with a Nespresso coffee, then stroll across the Commonwealth Avenue Mall to the Newbury Street shops, Prudential Center and Copley Square. Each apartment is an impeccable haven from the hubbub of the day-to-day, affording you the finest Boston has to offer. We offer turn down service for an additional cost so you will never need to do dishes or change sheets when you're on the go. We provide secure mail and package delivery. Finish the day with casual, or fine dining, all within walking distance of your Boston home. Close proximity to the Financial District, the Charles River, the South End, North End, MGH Hospital and Boston's underground, known as "The T."
space: Gloucester St is a quiet street located in the Heart of the Back Bay. Tastefully furnished and fitted with with upscale bedding and mattresses. Hardwood floors throughout, newly renovated apartment offers a spacious living room with a decorative fireplace and lots of windows. Ample closet space, luxury bed, 42 tv, wifi, cable tv, Xfinity movies, HBO, Nespresso machine, washer and dryer located in unit. This unit offers turn down service so fresh sheets, trash pick-up, or a meticulous cleaning are all at your fingertips.

To discover the rest of the city just grab the T just 2 blocks away. Boston’s Back Bay is known for its lovely
neighborhood_overview: There's plenty to offer within walking distance. Try out The Courtyard Restaurant or Montien Thai Restaurant for some of Boston's best dining. For shopping head over to the stylish Newbury Street. To discover the rest of the city just grab the T just 2 blocks away. Boston’s Back Bay is known for its lovely rows of Victorian houses, river-side walkways, fashionable shops, and delectable restaurants. Enjoy the historic charm and Paris-inspired landscape built from what use to be a true bay, and is now filled with acres of land and residential neighborhoods. Locals promote an active lifestyle and are often seen jogging along the Charles River Esplanade or indulging in pick-up games during the day. While at night, popular bars and restaurants are quick to fill up along the picturesque tree-lined streets.
notes: This Sonder does not allow early check-ins before 4:00pm. We apologize for any inconvenience. Due to renovations, you may encounter some construction that would be audible from the property after 8:30AM. There's limited parking in the area, but there's plenty to discover within walking distance - check out your Neighborhood Guide for suggestions.

house_rules: House Rules 1. All bookings require a security deposit of $300 or more. You will not be charged for this in advance. 2. Guests can cancel within 24 hours of booking and receive a full refund, or cancel anytime up to seven days before the start of your trip and receive a 50% refund. Trips cancelled fewer than seven days in advance are not eligible for refunds. If you cancel within 24 hours of booking, please reach out to our team, as this refund has to be processed manually.   3. Check-in time is any time after 4 pm. Check-out time is any time before 11 am. You're welcome to request an early check in or late checkout, but this is not guaranteed and we can only confirm 24 hours in advance. 4. We do not allow smoking; breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine. 5. Most of our locations do not allow pets. 6. Generally, parties or excessive noise are not allowed in our locations. house_rules: 1. You’re living like a local, be respectful of the other locals. We mean, c’mon, how would you feel if your neighbor wasn’t super awesome?  2. All of our Rental Units are smoke-free environments. Even on the balcony, if you have one. We’re super sorry if this is a bummer, but it’s our policy. Hopefully we told you about it ahead of time and you aren’t super surprised that we still mean it.  3. Pets are super awesome, but they aren’t allowed in our Rental Units. However, if your fur kiddo is a service animal or an emotional support animal, give us a call and we will make reasonable efforts to accommodate your needs, as required by law.   4. Your trip details should already be complete. If they aren’t, give us a call ASAP so we can rectify that! What’s a little information between friends?   5. Your friend, your responsibility. Pretty simple, if you invite them to your Rental Unit, you’re responsible for their actions.   6. While watching a million people get out of a clown car is hilar

summary: Amazing location in the heart of Boston with great views of the city and surrounding historic Back Bay neighborhood. I do live here when not booked with my 4 year old cat “Ricky.” Cat lovers only need apply, he is a kind, playful and social cat.

description: Amazing location in the heart of Boston with great views of the city and surrounding historic Back Bay neighborhood. I do live here when not booked with my 4 year old cat “Ricky.” Cat lovers only need apply, he is a kind, playful and social cat. This loft includes a fully equipped kitchen with a full refrigerator, full stove, and toaster. There is also a private bathroom with a shower for your personal use. The living space includes a pull out love seat with a twin mattress. The loft above has a memory foam king mattress. There is a 46" flatscreen TV with local channels; however, I recommend bringing your own streaming devices and connecting them via HDMI. There is excellent 5G Wifi available during your stay as well. Back Bay reigns as the premier neighborhood of Boston, where several of its top attractions are found. The Boston Public Library: Established in 1848, one of the oldest and largest libraries in the United States. Newbury Street: The most prominent pedestrian corridor in B
neighborhood_overview: Back Bay reigns as the premier neighborhood of Boston, where several of its top attractions are found. The Boston Public Library: Established in 1848, one of the oldest and largest libraries in the United States. Newbury Street: The most prominent pedestrian corridor in Boston with many shops, eateries, and art galleries. The Esplanade: A stretch of park spanning the waterfront edge on the charles river, with bike and jogging trails as well as docks and the hatch shell. The Prudential Center: An expansive indoor mall with over 75 retailers including a Tesla store and Eataly. Also many others including: Trinity Church, The Public Garden, Christian Science Plaza, Commonwealth Avenue Mall, Old South Church, Boston Symphony Hall, The Hynes Convention Center, Cheers, etc.
notes: Please be aware that this is on the top floor of a historic Victorian building and  there is not an elevator.
transit: Conveniently located to many MBTA transit stations and services in Boston including: The Back Bay Logan Express: Direct service to the Airport for pick up and drop off only 4 blocks away.  Copley T Station: Nearest T (subway) station on the Green line with easy connections to the Red and Orange lines  via the Park Street T stop, as well as the Blue line via the Government Center T stop. Back Bay Station: Orange line train station with commuter rail, and regional trains. The Boston Common Garage: Access for up to 1,350 vehicles open 24/7.
access: There is a 46" flatscreen TV with local channels; however, I recommend bringing your own streaming devices and connecting them via HDMI. There is excellent 5G Wifi available during your stay as well.

name: Cozy Studio in GREAT location (Downtown)
summary: LOCATION, quiet, and warmth - we are walking distance to most major attractions and restaurants and all subway lines, but nestled in the most quiet street in the area. Our home is very welcoming; we really enjoy having visitors and getting sticky notes from our guests. Although our studio is at garden level, it gets plenty of natural light, and has the best "backyard" in town, the Boston Public Garden. Welcome to our Play Base.
space: Besides the ideal location, our space is welcoming, with an open layout, a fuzzy carpet, and plenty of room to spread out, dance, do yoga, or whatever your heart desires. We also have a fully equipped kitchen if you prefer cooking. The apartment is usually very quiet despite a recent isolated event/review where a fire sensor was beeping all night because of a faulty sprinkler system. This isssue was resolved within 12 hours; the landlord is very responsive.

neighborhood_overview: Back bay and the nearby beacon hill neighborhoods are among the top places to live/visit. We are centrally located but live in a quiet street so you can come home and rest, after what I'm sure will be long days exploring this beautiful city.
notes: The exterior of the building is undergoing renovations hence why you will see construction scaffolding when you first arrive. However, the construction is on the top floors and outside, only done during business hours and can rarely be heard from inside the apartment. My wife and I used the apartment as our home office for the past 4 months and were never disturbed by the construction.
transit: You can walk to most places. If you need to take public transit, we are walking distance to all metro/subway lines, with great views along the way: - Green line: 3-4 minutes - Red line: 10-12 min - Orange line: 14 min - Blue line: 18 min
access: The whole space: bedroom, dining/living area, kitchen, bathroom, and closet.
interaction: Our cleaner comes in before every reservation. We will leave a key for you in a lock box outside the building.
house_rules: NA
host_about:
I like to live to the fullest and seize the moment but can switch to being responsible on a moment's notice. I very much subscribe to the MIT "Work Hard, Play Hard" way of life. I enjoy beer and wine. I also enjoy aged rums and whiskeys on occasions. I love outdoor activities, including but not limited to hiking, backpacking, snowboarding, skiing, horseback riding, biking, running, kayaking, canoeing, and sailing. I love running but don't do it nearly as much as I woud like. I have played in sports teams throughout my life, including basketball, soccer, crew, and softball. One of my dreams is to go to space although for now I'll settle for looking at this wonderful planet from 8,848 m or below. I am very close to my family and fraternity brothers but I also love meeting new people and getting out of the routine. 

Interests
Fitness, Snowboarding, Cooking, Theoretical Physics, History, Yoga, Science Fiction, Anime, anything fun, interesting, and out of the ordinary

Philosophy
-Live every day like it's your last 
-Let your love be known 
-Choose compassion
-Accept that everyone is different but we are all part of the same global community 
-Help those in need 
-Smile. It might change someone's life

Music, Movies, Books
-Almost all music but prefer Classic Rock, EDM, Funk, Spanish Guitar, Blues, and Alternative Rock and electronic 
-Science fictions, fantasy books and movies. Historical novels and books are also high up there, and I also enjoy mind-bending and cerebral movies.
Types of People I enjoy
-People who are open-minded and are willing to share their life experiences.

Teach, Learn, Share
Based on my educational background, I can offer technical knowledge and network of technical people. I would like to learn more about business and entrepreneurship, especially small online businesses. I would also like to learn more about your spiritual beliefs and experiences if you are willing.

Somos Venezolanos nos encanta el café con leche y pan caliente.

name: Contemporary Stay Alfred on Garrison Street
summary: Stay Alfred's latest Boston vacation rental combines the warmth and charm of nineteenth century architecture with twenty-first century amenities. At the crossroads of two historical neighborhoods, you will be a short walk from Back Bay's fashionable shops and the South End's hip restaurants and galleries.
space: Featuring a historic brick facade and wrought-iron details, the interior boasts every modern convenience, from a full kitchen to in-unit laundry. The spacious layout and stylish decor make this apartment the ideal place to recharge after a fresh seafood smorgasbord or a rousing Red Sox victory.
description: Stay Alfred's latest Boston vacation rental combines the warmth and charm of nineteenth century architecture with twenty-first century amenities. At the crossroads of two historical neighborhoods, you will be a short walk from Back Bay's fashionable shops and the South End's hip restaurants and galleries. The spacious layout and stylish decor make this apartment the ideal place to recharge after a fresh seafood smorgasbord or a rousing Red Sox victory. Your historic Garrison Street building embodies the charm and character of Back Bay, featuring a landscaped courtyard and expansive rooftop barbecue area - perfect for grilling up something to accompany your chowdah. All of our Rental Units are smoke-free environments. Even on the balcony, if you have one. We're super sorry if this is a bummer, but it's our policy. Hopefully we told you about it ahead of time and you aren't super surprised that we still mean it.  3. Pets are super awesome, but they aren't allowed in our Rental Units. However, if your fur kiddo is a service animal or an emotional support animal, give us a call and we will make reasonable efforts to accommodate your needs, as required by law.   4. Your trip details should already be complete. If they aren't, give us a call ASAP so we can rectify that! What's a little information between friends?   5. Your friend, your responsibility.
