name: Modern&Chic 1 Bedroom Apartment Back Bay!
summary: This gorgeous first floor apartment is right in the heart of Boston. It is located across from the Prudential, which has many shops and dining options. It is near Newbury Street, which is one of the most iconic places in Boston. It is also close to the Boston Commons and Public Garden. Both provide a picturesque view of Boston. It is near the Green Line of the T, so you can go to any part of Boston. This one bed makes a marvelous home, no matter how long the stay.
space: Back Bay is one of the most elegant and wealthy urban neighborhoods in the Boston Area. Well-preserved, 19th Century brownstones, more than half of Back Bay commuters walk to work. Besides the attractive historically significant architecture, the combination of shops, plentiful restaurants, and historical homes makes Back Bay a vibrant community with a great quality of life. Back Bay offer commuters the convenience of home to an international airport in 20 minutes. Let alone only a couple of hours to great Hiking, skiing and less to the beach! This 1 bedroom is located on the first floor of the building and is situated perfectly in a quiet and respectful bevy of neighbors. This apartment comes stocked with coffee, tea, breakfast granola/oatmeal. Wake up on the right side of the bed in this true modern sleek rental! Couch in the living room pulls out to a full size bed, and queen size bed in bedroom. 1 bathroom with tub shower. 50 inch flat screen TV in the living room as well as plenty

neighborhood_overview: This location scores a 99 on Walkscore for its central location to everything in Boston! You can see the Prudential Center from the front steps of the building! South End’s perfectly manicured parks and couture restaurants and cocktail lounges. Although a ritzy vibe emanates from South End’s classic brownstones, it tempers its upscale atmosphere with down-to-earth residents who happen to shop organically, buy gluten-free biscuits for their pets, and often refer to their neighborhood’s trendy boutiques as ‘fab.’ Conveniently located minutes from Downtown, everything offered by this chic locale is top-notch.
notes: We do not provide parking. Parking in the city can be very tough at times I would suggest that you do your research for garages and parking lots prior to your stay!
transit: The Green Line of the T is accessible at the Prudential stop.

name: Classic 2BR in Back Bay by Sonder
summary: At this Sonder, you'll love the lovely decor, fully-equipped kitchen, and spacious terrace access. Located in the Back Bay, known for its fashionable shops, and near the Charles River and Fenway Park,
space: NA
description: At this Sonder, you'll love the lovely decor, fully-equipped kitchen, and spacious terrace access. Located in the Back Bay, known for its fashionable shops, and near the Charles River and Fenway Park, Boston’s Back Bay is known for its lovely rows of Victorian houses, river-side walkways, fashionable shops, and delectable restaurants. Enjoy the historic charm and Paris-inspired landscape built from what use to be a true bay, and is now filled with acres of land and residential neighborhoods. Locals promote an active lifestyle and are often seen jogging along the Charles River Esplanade or indulging in pick-up games during the day. While at night, popular bars and restaurants are quick to fill up along the picturesque tree-lined streets. Your Sonder's keys will be found in a lockbox and we'll be sending you detailed access information three days before your stay. If you need any help, just give us a call. This is a garden-level Sonder with stair access only, and no elevator.

interaction: NA
house_rules: House Rules 1. All bookings require a security deposit of $300 or more. You will not be charged for this in advance. 2. Guests can cancel within 24 hours of booking and receive a full refund, or cancel anytime up to seven days before the start of your trip and receive a 50% refund. Trips cancelled fewer than seven days in advance are not eligible for refunds. If you cancel within 24 hours of booking, please reach out to our team, as this refund has to be processed manually.   3. Check-in time is any time after 4 pm. Check-out time is any time before 11 am. You're welcome to request an early check in or late checkout, but this is not guaranteed and we can only confirm 24 hours in advance. 4. We do not allow smoking of any kind, including but not limited to nicotine, tobacco derived products and/or cannabis derived substances; breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine. 5. Most of our locations do not allow pets. 6. Generally, parties or excessive noise are not allowed in our locations. I
host_about: Sonder is reimagining the way people travel. Now in 20+ cities, we’ve been featured in The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, and named 2019’s most innovative hospitality brand by Fast Company. We’ve taken the best parts of home and hotel and combined them into an entirely new experience. All of our spaces are uniquely designed, have 24/7 guest support, and contain all the essentials you need for an impeccable stay. No matter what you’re looking for, there’s a Sonder for you.

name: Back Bay, top Boston-location !
summary: This is the most central location you could ask for in Boston. Affluent Back Bay is where you’ll find the famous Newbury Street; your shopping and dining destination.  A stones throw away from the Public Garden and Boston Common. Mansions dot the neighborhood’s tree-lined streets, many on Paris-inspired Commonwealth Avenue. Close to all public transportation - this cozy place is all you need while visiting Boston. I take pride in the cleanliness of my place so ask the same of my guests.
space: This is a great studio apartment with one bedroom, a queen bed, two couches and a queen size blow up bed for use. You’ll be looking over the prestigious Commonwealth Ave from my front facing apartment. You’re welcome to cook and use all utilities. Includes all linens and towels, and high speed Wifi. Cute little eating area offered as well. Great location in the Back Bay area…minutes to great restaurants and bars with a 5 minute drive into downtown. This unit also has a two person elevator great for luggage or any shopping from throughout the day.

neighborhood_overview: This spot is located close to any and all necessities, there’s a Starbucks directly around the corner as well as my favorite coffee spot The Thinking Cup, there’s restaurants from breakfast, fast food, or fine dining all within a 10 minute walking radius. There’s Chanel and Tiffany’s a five minute walk one way and all other popular stores the other way. This is situated on the prestigious Commonwealth Ave where the park sits in front of you and the Public Garden and Boston Common no more than a 4 minute walk. Beyond is downtown crossing which has a movie theatre, more restaurants, bars, speak easy’s, GAP, Marshalls, TJ Maxx, & Primark along with others.
notes: With this gorgeous weather finally getting to us in Boston you won’t believe how this city has come alive. Only a 5 minute walk to the Charles River where people kayak, have a picnic, paddle board, go for a walk or run, or just sit back and relax in a bench or the beautiful grounds surrounding the area and take it all in! Only a few minutes to the Public Garden & The Boston Common or Head the other way for all your shopping and foodie pleasures ! You couldn’t get a better location to enjoy Boston !
transit: NA
access: This property has access to an elevator which is one short flight of stairs. It is a gated elevator so I caution you to use the handle so you don’t risk hurting your fingers. It’s very convenient for any luggage or shopping you may have.
interaction: I will be readily available to stay in communication with you throughout your stay. I can make recommendations and answer any possible questions you may have.
house_rules: I have no problem taking care of any dishes left from use but I do ask for the shoes to be left at the door. Thanks so much !
host_about: I've traveled near and far and can say this city we call Bean Town has my heart! I am more than happy to open my place up to letting others have the experience I have on one of the most beautiful streets and most centrally desirable located areas in all of Boston !

neighborhood_overview: Filled with historic brownstones and tree-lined streets, Boston’s Back Bay is one of America’s most desirable neighborhoods in which to live. Take a stroll down picturesque Commonwealth Avenue or go shopping on world famous Newbury Street, called by many the Rodeo Drive of Boston. Filled with high-end international designer label shops, art galleries, restaurants, and more, Newbury Street is a great place to spot a celebrity or a local sport star while window shopping.
notes: An additional queen size air bed can be accommodated in the living room for an additional flat fee of $150 per stay.  Pack N' Plays are available for no additional cost. A 24-hour notice should be provided if an air mattress is needed.
transit: Commute like a local using Boston's infamous MBTA system. Arlington Green Line Station and Boylston St Green Line Station are located a short walk away. We recommend purchasing weekly passes for 3+ night stays if guests are planning on using the subway or bus system often. Check Boston's MBTA website for prices and subway maps.  Remember to always check street signs and meters if you are planning on driving in. We highly recommend parking at a local garage and leaving your car there until you are ready to go. Parking in Boston can be very complicated and expensive.
access: The Back Bay Beacon is equipped with a keyless, self-check-in system to allow guests a sense of security and independence during their stay. The staff @ Inn Boston Reservations will create custom codes for guests entire stay three days before their arrival date and send them via email.
interaction: Staff is physically available during office hours to assist with any questions or issues. However, our office is located off-site but within a short commuting distance of the property. Our communication is typically via email, phone or booking site.  Our sister hotel assists with overnight calls and emergencies.

Inn Boston Reservations is a central reservation and property management service located in Boston, Massachusetts. IBR provides corporate housing, vacation rentals and fully furnished apartments in premier locations throughout the City including Back Bay, Beacon Hill, Copley Square, South End, Bay Village and Newbury Street. Each suite is uniquely appointed and carefully selected to provide convenience to public transportation, shopping and historic sites.

Amenities include keyless entry, free wireless internet, cable television and local telephone service. Some units feature roof decks, fire places, multiple bathrooms and laundry facilities.

IBR easily accommodates business and corporate travel or people vacationing with friends and family. Furnished apartments range is size from studios, 1, 2 and 3 bedroom apartments. Each flat is located in a historic brownstone or a brick townhouse. Our guests enjoy a comfortable and safe surrounding with privacy and the convenience of knowing we are just a phone call away.

For more information on Inn Boston Reservations, please visit us (Email hidden by Airbnb)

name: The Copley Garrison One Bedroom Suite
summary: The Copley Garrison is one of many Inn Boston Reservations furnished rentals. Located minutes from Boston's largest indoor shopping center, two of the largest buildings in the city, and a variety of banquet and convention centers, the Copley Garrison is the perfect location for business travelers, couples and families alike. Get to experience the city like a local and return to your fully equipped, relaxing apartment.
space: Our suites are equipped with cooking, dining, and silverware as well as essential ingredients and a complimentary breakfast basket. Extra linens and towels are provided in the suites as well as toilet paper and toiletries. Coin operated laundry facilities are located in the basement for guests to use. The Copley Garrison does not have elevator access. Guests are to use the stairs to get to their suite and to enter/exit the building.

name: Penthouse Level suite in the Heart of Back Bay
summary: Light and airy 1 private one bedroom Guest Suite centrally located on the 7th floor in the HEART of Back Bay!  Walk everywhere! Common deck one level up is a relaxing way to spend the afternoon with 360 degree views of the Charles River and all of Back Bay...
space: is sun filled 3 room private guest suite that occupies the back half of a larger unit.  The suite is separated from the main apartment by a locked door, and has a separate entrance from the main hallway.  It is essentially a separate apartment, but without a full kitchen.  Overall the space is approximately 220 sq. ft. THE BEDROOM  features a  non-working period fireplace and views of the Back Bay as well as the iconic Citgo sign in Kenmore Square, a full size bed with Brooklinen Luxe bedding, Leesa mattress, Nest pillows, double closet, and a writing desk/chair.   THE BATHROOM is white Carrera marble with double vanity, medicine cabinet and shower/bath ensemble. THE LAST ROOM  is a combination of sitting/TV area, and kitchenette.  Please note that there is  NOT A FULL KITCHEN in the suite  (see photos).  However, it does offer a kitchenette, and has all of the the appliance and tools necessary to prepare meals for 1 or 2 people, including mid-size toaster oven for broiling/baking,  si
description: Light and airy 1 private one bedroom Guest Suite centrally located on the 7th floor in the HEART of Back Bay!  Walk everywhere! Common deck one level up is a relaxing way to spend the afternoon with 360 degree views of the Charles River and all of Back Bay... is sun filled 3 room private guest suite that occupies the back half of a larger unit.  The suite is separated from the main apartment by a locked door, and has a separate entrance from the main hallway.  It is essentially a separate apartment, but without a full kitchen.  Overall the space is approximately 220 sq. ft. THE BEDROOM  features a  non-working period fireplace and views of the Back Bay as well as the iconic Citgo sign in Kenmore Square, a full size bed with Brooklinen Luxe bedding, Leesa mattress, Nest pillows, double closet, and a writing desk/chair.   THE BATHROOM is white Carrera marble with double vanity, medicine cabinet and shower/bath ensemble. THE LAST ROOM  is a combination of sitting/TV area, and kitchenette.
neighborhood_overview: Boston is an iconic city and you will be staying in the heart of it all.  Steps away from the Public Garden, Beacon Hill, the Charles River, and all of the shops and restaurants along Newbury Street.   Marlborough street is one of the most historic streets in the city, still lit by gas powered street lamps.  It is completely residential, and truly has a neighborhood feel in spite of the fact that it is in the heart in the city.  The buildings are incredibly well preserved and still reflect a variety of period architecture.  (Broadly speaking, the Back Bay architecture overall is cited as one of the best examples of Victorian and Eduardian architecture in the United States.)
notes: Being on the top floor, the space is very quiet with minimal street sounds and has fantastic views of the Back Bay skyline and all of the history along Marlborough St.  It is like stepping back into another period of time. The building itself was built at the turn of the century and reflects the detail of the times.   As this is a boutique building with only 7 floors, there are only 18 apartments in the entire building.   As a result, the building never seems bustling.  It is a nice quiet pace that contrasts the busy city. THE MOST SPECIAL PART about this rental is access to a common rooftop deck (merely one floor above) that boasts some of the best views in all of Back Bay.   Many major city landmarks can be seen from this deck; Trinity Church steeple (the church was built in 1872), Fenway Park, the Charles River (great for sailboat watching), the Iconic CITGO sign, State House gold dome.  The list goes on... Sunsets here can be breathtaking.   Overall, as this is such a small buildin
transit: Public transportation is only steps away as well; a 5 minute walk to the Copley T Station and 5 more minutes to the Back Bay train station.  The shops along Newbury and Boylston. Streets are literally minutes away.  Boston (proper) is a very walkable city; this location is truly centrally located if you wish to venture out by foot.
access: Guests will be able to access only the 3 rooms contained in the guest suite.
interaction: I live in the adjoining space (behind a locked door) and will be available to help make your stay as comfortable or to answer any questions that you may have about your visit to Boston.  In the event that I am out of town during your stay, we will make alternative arrangements to ensure a seamless check-in process, but I will still be accessible to answer any questions that you may have.
house_rules: •	Quiet hours are 11PM to 7AM •	NO SMOKING of any kind either within the building or inside of the apartment; if this rule is not respected, it is grounds for immediate eviction with no reimbursement •	No open flames whatsoever •	Please use mat in front of door to wipe your feet before entering, removing shoes is at your discretion and should be respectful of the outside conditions •	The door separating the front from the back half of the apartment is locked, please do not attempt to enter the front have of the apartment as it alarmed •	Please do not place any luggage on the bed, there are luggage racks provided for your convenience •	Please be sure to clean all dishware/pots/pans/utensils that you have used during your stay, and return them to their original location •	No guests other than those whom have already received approval and have been booked/paid •	No parties or loud music  •	No illegal activity anywhere on the premises •	No pets or animals of any kind •	If you break or dama
host_about:
I am a business professional that travels pretty regularly, so am not around a lot.  In my spare time, I enjoy working out and travel.  My more recent trips included Iceland, Argentina and Japan.  Learning about different cultures has always been of interest to me.

As a host, I my goal is to be sure that I provide a similar experience as I would like to have during my travels.  A place that's pristine, lives up to the description, and an overall experience that leaves you wanting to come back.

There's plenty to offer within walking distance. Try out The Courtyard Restaurant or Montien Thai Restaurant for some of Boston's best dining. For shopping head over to the stylish Newbury Street. To discover the rest of the city just grab the T just 2 blocks away. Boston’s Back Bay is known for its lovely
neighborhood_overview: There's plenty to offer within walking distance. Try out The Courtyard Restaurant or Montien Thai Restaurant for some of Boston's best dining. For shopping head over to the stylish Newbury Street. To discover the rest of the city just grab the T just 2 blocks away. Boston’s Back Bay is known for its lovely rows of Victorian houses, river-side walkways, fashionable shops, and delectable restaurants. Enjoy the historic charm and Paris-inspired landscape built from what use to be a true bay, and is now filled with acres of land and residential neighborhoods. Locals promote an active lifestyle and are often seen jogging along the Charles River Esplanade or indulging in pick-up games during the day. While at night, popular bars and restaurants are quick to fill up along the picturesque tree-lined streets.
notes: This Sonder does not allow early check-ins before 4:00pm. We apologize for any inconvenience. Due to renovations, you may encounter some construction that would be audible from the property after 8:30AM. There's limited parking in the area, but there's plenty to discover within walking distance - check out your Neighborhood Guide for suggestions.
transit: NA
access: NA
interaction: NA
house_rules: House Rules 1. All bookings require a security deposit of $300 or more. You will not be charged for this in advance. 2. Guests can cancel within 24 hours of booking and receive a full refund, or cancel anytime up to seven days before the start of your trip and receive a 50% refund. Trips cancelled fewer than seven days in advance are not eligible for refunds. If you cancel within 24 hours of booking, please reach out to our team, as this refund has to be processed manually.   3. Check-in time is any time after 4 pm. Check-out time is any time before 11 am. You're welcome to request an early check in or late checkout, but this is not guaranteed and we can only confirm 24 hours in advance. 4. We do not allow smoking; breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine. 5. Most of our locations do not allow pets. 6. Generally, parties or excessive noise are not allowed in our locations. It may be possible to obtain permission to host a party; contact our team to learn more.  7. If a location is lef
host_about: Sonder is reimagining the way people travel. Now in 20+ cities, we’ve been featured in The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, and named 2019’s most innovative hospitality brand by Fast Company. We’ve taken the best parts of home and hotel and combined them into an entirely new experience. All of our spaces are uniquely designed, have 24/7 guest support, and contain all the essentials you need for an impeccable stay. No matter what you’re looking for, there’s a Sonder for you.

name: Modern 2br @ Prudential Ctr Back Bay & South end!
summary: Beautiful historical brownstone building with stunning design. Located across street from Prudential Center, Christian science center reflecting pool in the heart of Back Bay & South End, simply stunning and will amaze you! Famous restaurants and shops at your doorstep. Down street from Fenway Park, Boston Commons, Public Garden, Cambridge, Beacon Hill,  Boston Public Library, Kenmore and Fenway. Private entrance. Stay here for the best dining and shopping experience Boston has to offer!
space: Spacious hardwood floors. Living room and Bedrooms are clean, and well lit. Modern Kitchen is fully equipped for cooking needs. Please note that the sofa bed will be converted to a queen bed for additional person staying; extra pillows and blanket provided. Washer & Dryer in unit.

notes: There is metered street parking. St. Botolph Street, Huntington Avenue and Massachusetts Avenue have metered parking. There is also parking available at 4 Cumberland Street Garage and the Prudential Center. You can reach them by (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) searching "4 Cumberland Street Garage" and "Prudential Center Boston Parking Garage". Sidestreet are resident parking after 6pm (except Sundays).

interaction: Happy to provide tips and suggestions as you plan your trip, and if you have any questions during your stay please send requests via Airbnb messaging.
house_rules: - - No smoking - - No parties, events, loud music or loud noise. - - No pets - - Self check-in with lockbox - - Check in is anytime after 2PM - - Check out by 10AM - - No free parking available - - Coming through front entrance will require going down 1 flight of stairs and leaving through front entrance will require going up 1 flight of stairs. - - Entering and exiting through private back door does not require climbing stairs.
host_about: I'm originally from Boston. I love movies, traveling, swimming, shooting pool, bowling, ping-pong, football, roller coasters/theme parks, skiing, and hiking! I love the movie The Shawshank Redemption. I like to listen to classic rock mostly Guns N' Roses, Led Zeppelin, The Beatles and The Animals. I'm an American at heart but my taste buds favor food from Thailand. I love new life experiences, stepping out of my comfort zone, being a good friend, entertaining others and showing people a good time. My life motto is, "Everything in moderation". I'm 29 years old, ambitious and full of life! Here to make your Boston stay, the best stay possible! Always available to give great travel advice, restaurant and night life suggestions or help out with any other questions or concerns that may arise regarding maintenance and repairs. On the Airbnb Messenger you'll be speaking with myself. In the event of an emergency I can be reached by phone via text message or phone call. Come visit our Strong city of Boston! Home Sweet Home, professionally managed for an amazing experience and memorable visit, vacation or tour of Boston!

summary: Blending historic architecture and modern sensibilities, our apartments in Back Bay offer the very finest in contemporary, sophistication and elegance in the core of Boston. Inside, each apartment is an impeccable haven from the hubbub of the day-to-day, affording you the finest. We offer turn down service for an additional cost so you will never need to do dishes or change sheets when you're on the go. we provide secure, controlled mail and package delivery. Within blocks of bustling restaurants, chic shops and the MBTA. Close proximity to the Financial District, the Charles River, the North End, and BackBay.

summary: This gorgeous, RENOVATED, garden level studio is in a fabulous location! It is right across from the famous Prudential Center. It is near the iconic Newbury Street, where you can shop and dine. It is in walking distance to the Boston Commons and Public Garden. neighborhood_overview: South End’s perfectly manicured parks and couture restaurants and cocktail lounges. Although a ritzy vibe emanates from South End’s classic brownstones, it tempers its upscale atmosphere with down-to-earth residents who happen to shop organically, buy gluten-free biscuits for their pets, and often refer to their neighborhood’s trendy boutiques as ‘fab.’ Conveniently located minutes from Downtown, everything offered by this chic locale is top-notch.
notes: We do not provide parking. Parking in the city can be very tough at times I would suggest that you do your research for garages and parking lots prior to your stay!

name: The Copley Garrison One Bedroom Suite
summary: The Copley Garrison is one of many Inn Boston Reservations furnished rentals. Located minutes from Boston's largest indoor shopping center, two of the largest buildings in the city, and a variety of banquet and convention centers, the Copley Garrison is the perfect location for business travelers, couples and families alike. Get to experience the city like a local and return to your fully equipped, relaxing apartment.
space: Our suites are equipped with cooking, dining, and silverware as well as essential ingredients and a complimentary breakfast basket. Extra linens and towels are provided in the suites as well as toilet paper and toiletries. Coin operated laundry facilities are located in the basement for guests to use. The Copley Garrison does not have elevator access. Guests are to use the stairs to get to their suite and to enter/exit the building.
description: The Copley Garrison is one of many Inn Boston Reservations furnished rentals. Located minutes from Boston's largest indoor shopping center, two of the largest buildings in the city, and a variety of banquet and convention centers, the Copley Garrison is the perfect location for business travelers, couples and families alike. Get to experience the city like a local and return to your fully equipped, relaxing apartment. Our suites are equipped with cooking, dining, and silverware as well as essential ingredients and a complimentary breakfast basket. Extra linens and towels are provided in the suites as well as toilet paper and toiletries. Coin operated laundry facilities are located in the basement for guests to use. The Copley Garrison does not have elevator access. Guests are to use the stairs to get to their suite and to enter/exit the building. The Copley Garrison is equipped with a keyless, self-check-in system to allow guests a sense of security and independence during their stay.
neighborhood_overview: The Copley Garrison is located right off of busy Huntington Avenue, in a quiet Brownstone neighborhood.  Prudential Center and Copley Place, two of Boston's largest shopping centers, are within walking distance as well as Boylston St and Newbury St, also famous for their wide variety of shopping and dining options.  Prudential Green Line Station is located a short two-minute walk away allowing guests access to public transportation in Boston, Cambridge, and surrounding cities.  Enjoy a delicious dinner at Lucca's Back Bay or a great coffee at Caffe Nero, a short walk away.
notes: An additional bed can be accommodated in the living room. Air beds are available for an additional fee. A 24-hour notice should be provided if an air mattress is needed. Pack N' Plays are available for no additional cost. A 24-hour notice should be provided if an air mattress is needed.
transit: Commute like a local using Boston's infamous MBTA system. Prudential Green Line Station is located a short walk away. We recommend purchasing weekly passes for 3+ night stays if guests are planning on using the subway or bus system often. Check Boston's MBTA website for prices and subway maps.  Remember to always check street signs and meters if you are planning on driving in. We highly recommend parking at a local garage and leaving your car there until you are ready to leave. Parking in Boston can be very complicated and expensive.
access: The Copley Garrison is equipped with a keyless, self-check-in system to allow guests a sense of security and independence during their stay. The staff @ Inn Boston Reservations will create custom codes for guests entire stay three days before their arrival date and send them via email.
interaction: Staff is physically available during office hours to assist with any questions or issues. However, our office is located off-site but within walking distance of the property. Our communication is typically via email, phone or booking site.  Our sister hotel assists with overnight calls and emergencies.
house_rules: Inn Boston Reservations requests that noise levels remain moderate to low, and that all guests take into consideration those in the surrounding suites. Depending on the scale of the broken rules, guests may be contacted to request a lower noise level or asked to leave. In the event that the guests are required to vacate the unit, no refund will be provided.
host_about:
Inn Boston Reservations is a central reservation and property management service located in Boston, Massachusetts. IBR provides corporate housing, vacation rentals and fully furnished apartments in premier locations throughout the City including Back Bay, Beacon Hill, Copley Square, South End, Bay Village and Newbury Street. Each suite is uniquely appointed and carefully selected to provide convenience to public transportation, shopping and historic sites.

Amenities include keyless entry, free wireless internet, cable television and local telephone service. Some units feature roof decks, fire places, multiple bathrooms and laundry facilities.

IBR easily accommodates business and corporate travel or people vacationing with friends and family. Furnished apartments range is size from studios, 1, 2 and 3 bedroom apartments. Each flat is located in a historic brownstone or a brick townhouse. Our guests enjoy a comfortable and safe surrounding with privacy and the convenience of knowing we are just a phone call away.

For more information on Inn Boston Reservations, please visit us (Email hidden by Airbnb)

host_about:
Inn Boston Reservations is a central reservation and property management service located in Boston, Massachusetts. IBR provides corporate housing, vacation rentals and fully furnished apartments in premier locations throughout the City including Back Bay, Beacon Hill, Copley Square, South End, Bay Village and Newbury Street. Each suite is uniquely appointed and carefully selected to provide convenience to public transportation, shopping and historic sites.

Amenities include keyless entry, free wireless internet, cable television and local telephone service. Some units feature roof decks, fire places, multiple bathrooms and laundry facilities.

IBR easily accommodates business and corporate travel or people vacationing with friends and family. Furnished apartments range is size from studios, 1, 2 and 3 bedroom apartments. Each flat is located in a historic brownstone or a brick townhouse. Our guests enjoy a comfortable and safe surrounding with privacy and the convenience of knowing we are just a phone call away.

For more information on Inn Boston Reservations, please visit us (Email hidden by Airbnb)

Along Newbury Street, well-heeled locals frequent designer
neighborhood_overview: Affluent Back Bay is a shopping and dining destination. Along Newbury Street, well-heeled locals frequent designer boutiques, fashion chains, art galleries and patio cafes set in elegant brick townhouses. Expansive Copley Square is flanked by 1800s landmarks Trinity Church and the Boston Public Library. Mansions dot the neighborhood’s tree-lined streets, many on Paris-inspired Commonwealth Avenue. The sprawling Fenway-Kenmore area is home to baseball’s iconic Fenway Park, drawing huge crowds for Red Sox games. Student hangouts and buzzy restaurants are concentrated around Kenmore Square, and clubs and sports bars line Lansdowne Street. Renowned cultural institutions include the Museum of Fine Arts and quirky Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum. The rambling Back Bay Fens park has a rose garden and walking trails.
notes: I am available 24/7 for my guests.
transit: Many Subway Stops in the area, Uber and Lyft on Demand, and you can WALK, Walk, Walk!

name: Huge 1 Bedroom in Heart of Back Bay
summary: In a city where space and location are everything, this apartment is truly a rare find. Boasting one full bedroom, a spacious living room, and prime Back Bay real estate, this apartment makes for the perfect place to rest after a day of exploring the best that Boston has to offer.
space: Simple and comfortable, the apartment accommodates four guests as the bedroom has a queen size bed and the couch in the living room pulls out into a bed as well for extra sleeping space. An air mattress can also be provided upon request. The kitchen is stocked with basic cookware and a Keurig coffee machine. Please help yourself to the plethora of coffee pods provided as we wouldn't want the afternoon slump to get in the way of your travels. Linens, towels, and bathroom amenities will be provided. We are here to provide you with the comfort of a home and confidence of a hotel.

neighborhood_overview: Victorian brownstone homes and picturesque tree lined streets with old style gas lamps situated among the best restaurants and shopping in Boston; this is the best way to describe Back Bay. You will be walking distance to Newbury Street and the Prudential Center which will be great for your wardrobe but maybe not for your wallet. Back Bay is one of the most elite neighborhoods in Boston making for an upscale experience on your Boston getaway.
notes: Like what you see but it's not quite right? Please note that we have multiple listings available ranging from studios to four bedroom apartments! Feel free to check out our other listings on our Airbnb profile.
transit: Did you know you can walk the entire city of Boston in just five hours? Want to give your feet a rest? Take the "T" or download the Lyft app. Ask us for a discount code if you are a first time Lyft user!
access: In addition to full access to the apartment, our guests will receive exclusive discounts to some of the best attractions in Boston. Ride and float through the city on a Boston Duck Tour; save money on the absolute best way to see Boston. Finding Nemo at the world famous New England Aquarium comes at a discounted rate for our guests. Need restaurant recommendations? We're foodies at heart, and happy to recommend some of the top spots in the city.
interaction: We do our best to tailor each experience to our guests preferences. Want advice, suggestions, or a shoulder to lean on? We are always available and at your disposal. Need a place to stay but don't feel like chatting? That's okay too, we won't be offended.

name: Best Location in Boston
summary: Full apartment on the Back Bay / South End line with all the amenities: Wifi, washer, dryer, dishwasher, and TV.  Steps from the city's best restaurants, Newburry Street, Copley, the Pru, the Duck Tours, a 3 minute walk to the orange and green lines, and a 7 minute walk to the Hynes convention center (only 1 minute uncovered if it is raining).  2 blocks from a grocery store and a Starbucks.  3 gyms and a cycling studio within a 4 minute walk (all with day passes or free trials).
space: Gas stove and everything you need to cook: pots, pans, olive oil, salt, spices - let me know what you need and I'll make sure to have it.  Or, if you don't feel like cooking, go to one of the dozens of delicious restaurants in the area.  My favorite: the Brahman ( (Website hidden by Airbnb) and they usually have an active groupon!)

If you plan to use them, please let me know during check-in so I can show you how to operate them - Feel free to set the heat/AC to any temperature that is comfortable for you.  If you are leaving for the day/checking out, it would be helpful if you could turn the AC off/warmer, or in the winter turn the heat to 65-70 degrees. -The windows are very heavy.  If you would like to open the windows, please use the black spacers to keep them open (they can fall down and crack the glass) - Check in is between 5pm and 6:30pm. name: Summer Specials! - Luxurious Back Bay Studio
summary: In the heart of Back Bay and steps The Public Garden, shopping on Newbury Street or a stroll along the Charles River my luxury condo is the perfect Airbnb for your next stay in Boston!  You'll be amazed by the high ceiling, the classic feeling of being in a Boston brownstone, and will love the central location of this condo.  Perfect for couples, solo adventurers, or business travelers. I look forward to hosting you.
space: Plenty of space to spread out in this recently remodeled condo. New bathroom with standup shower and newly renovated kitchen.  Although tasty restaurants are abundant in Boston, you'll have everything you'll need at home to make a home cooked meal, including stainless steel appliances, microwave, dishwasher, coffee maker, and all the necessary accoutrements such as plates, utensils, and cookware. You'll have a queen size bed, two sitting chairs, and an extra large TV with cable for your enjoyment.  Have a third or wish to not share a bed? Let us know before arrival and we can inflate a queen size air mattress for an extra sleeping option.  Finally, there's tons of natural light from the oversize windows. A short 9 minute walk to The Boston Marathon Finish Line !!

neighborhood_overview: Walk to the left a few hundred feet and you'll hit the Charles River, walk to the right and you'll land upon Newbury Street, Boylston Street and Commonwealth Avenue which has some of the area's best restaurants, unique boutique stores, and classic Boston brownstones. You are steps away from the Boston Marathon Finish Line! Take in the views atop the Prudential Center, visit Trinity Church, or The Boston Public Library, all within a short walk of the studio. Easy T ride many popular destinations:  North End Freedom Trail Museum of Fine Arts, Boston Faneuil Hall Marketplace Boston Common
notes: When booking, please tell us about yourself and what brings you to Boston. We ask that you have finished the Airbnb verification process by verifying one social media account and scanning your offline ID. Go to www.airbnb.com/verify for more info.  For parking options, I love the app called SpotHero as discounted parking option in Boston can be at a premium! Ask us for a first time user promo code. We cannot offer space to store your bags past 11AM on your check out day or earlier than 3PM on your arrival day. We recommend using the app called StoreMe which has luggage storage all over town. Use the promo code "bnbbos" to get $3 off the first hour of your reservation. There may not be a storage solution near the property but you should be able to find them near most T stops or perhaps by your first destination! A quick note about taxes. Beginning July 1st 2019, the city of Boston will collect city and state taxes on short term rentals. We don't have the exact rate yet but it will likel
transit: Although seeing Boston by foot, is easy in a location so central, we are located near numerous buses and trains too. We are a 12 minute walk to the orange line at Back Bay Station, a short 10 minute walk to the green line to catch a Sox game at Fenway, and minutes to many local buses.
access: You'll have full access to the studio, which is stocked with essential toiletries, towels and linens. An iron, ironing board, and hair dryer are also available for use.
interaction: Always available via the Airbnb app and available via cell phone at night. Have a question or need suggestions on things to do? Do not hesitate to ask!!!
house_rules: -Leave the apartment as you found it.  -Quiet time starts at 9PM. -No shoes allowed in the apartment.  -Please respect us and our neighbors by not having any additional guests.  -No parties. -Smoking is strictly prohibited both inside and within 50ft of the outside.  -No pets. -No packages may be sent to the house without host approval.
host_about:
I am a facilitator and I enjoy getting to know people with different thinking minds and opinions.  I like stylish yet affordable  designs. I am fond of particularly wearable accessories.I also enjoy making my guests comfortable as if they are at their home.
Therefore welcome to your home :)

name: Stayloom’s Charming Brownstone | Back Bay
summary: Stayloom is dedicated to giving you a luxurious and authentic travel experience. From the refurbished table to the local artwork, our homes are furnished so every detail has a genuine connection to the surrounding community. Spacious and suitable for groups of all sizes, each Stayloom home is crafted with the intention of bringing family and friends together. Stay in style. Stay for the stories. Stayloom.
space: Located in the center of Back Bay, one of Boston’s most coveted zip codes, our one bedroom, one bathroom apartment can comfortably accommodate up to four guests. The space is ideal for travelers seeking a first-rate Boston experience. The condo has been thoughtfully designed and appointed to experience the city in style and comfort. - The new kitchen is stocked with dishes, silverware, and essential cooking utensils (a drip coffee maker, coffee, olive oil etc. is also stocked for your use and convenience) - Smart TV preloaded with applications, wifi - All beds feature Tempurpedic-quality mattresses and silky, high thread count linens. - All bathrooms are immaculate and include essential toiletries and stacks of plush cotton towels.
description: Stayloom is dedicated to giving you a luxurious and authentic travel experience. neighborhood_overview: Our condo is located in the heart of the Back Bay, one of the most exclusive and coveted neighborhoods in Boston. This brownstone is in the very center of Boston's major attractions, while also offering the peace of a quiet residential enclave. Just one block from the Boston Public Garden, three blocks from Newbury St., and closeby to the city’s best shops/nightlife/and restaurants - it doesn't get more centrally located than this! All guests after booking will receive a personalized list of recommendations including locals favorite spots, restaurants, and activities. We will provide detailed information and guides on the surrounding area to enhance your overall experience.
notes: If you have questions you need answered before securing your booking, or you simply want to talk with us first, reach out to our Stayloom team with an inquiry before a reservation request. Please also note that one-night stays on the weekend or reservations that start or end on a Saturday may be subject to an additional fee. Want more options? Check out Stayloom’s other homes located in popular destinations across the nation such as Boston, Savannah, New Orleans, and more! At Stayloom, we make sure you find the perfect fit. Damage deposit: $500 (non-Airbnb reservations only)
transit: Located in the heart of the city, you can walk just about anywhere. We are closeby to a number of train stops as well as bikesharing stations. While you don’t need a car to get around, there are several parking garages in close proximity in addition to metered street parking.
access: The entire home is for your exclusive use.
interaction: You will have complete privacy here, however every question or concern you may have before or during your stay will be promptly addressed via messenger or phone. In the case of a maintenance emergency, our ground team is available to assist you. Entry is simple, there’s no need to coordinate key pick up.
house_rules: - Please respect Boston's noise ordinance. Quiet hours begin at 11:00pm, weekdays & weekends. - Any visit from the local police department will result in immediate eviction without refund.
host_about:
I am a proud member of the Stayloom network! My personal loves include my new daughter, traveling with my family, and trying to beat the NYT crossword puzzle. Part of the joy for me is in providing a platform to let you discover what I love about my two favorite cities: Boston and New York. I hope I have the chance to show you their amazing energies and vibrant cultures.

Cheers,
Franklin
Stay Heirloom

name: Adorable Comm Ave Studio for the Weary Traveler
summary: Nestled in one of the beautiful brownstones that dot the Comm Ave Mall, this cozy studio is just steps away from the Charles River for that gorgeous walk or shopping and dining on Newbury Street. Just a 5 minute walk from the subway, it's perfectly situated for your visit to Boston. Get a taste of local living in Boston!
space: Everything in my home is available for you to use!  * One twin sized bed * Full kitchen and fridge for cooking  * Closet space (exposed garment racks) and drawers  * There are two flights of stairs - there is no elevator * Laundry in building (coin operated) * Record player and jazz record collection  * French press for coffee or lots of tea! * Unfortunately, I do not have a TV. The apartment is in a building shared with year-round residents, so we ask that guests be respectful of others in the building. This is a professional building, please no children. WiFi, hairdryer, iron all provided.

name: Imaginative Back Bay Condo!
summary: Stay Alfred’s latest Boston vacation rental combines the warmth and charm of nineteenth century architecture with twenty-first century amenities. At the crossroads of two historical neighborhoods, you will be a short walk from Back Bay’s fashionable shops and the South End’s hip restaurants and galleries.
space: Featuring a historic brick facade and wrought-iron details, the interior boasts every modern convenience, from a full kitchen to in-unit laundry. The spacious layout and stylish decor make this apartment the ideal place to recharge after a fresh seafood smorgasbord or a rousing Red Sox victory.
description: Stay Alfred’s latest Boston vacation rental combines the warmth and charm of nineteenth century architecture with twenty-first century amenities. At the crossroads of two historical neighborhoods, you will be a short walk from Back Bay’s fashionable shops and the South End’s hip restaurants and galleries. Featuring a historic brick facade and wrought-iron details, the interior boasts every modern convenience, from a full kitchen to in-unit laundry. The spacious layout and stylish decor make this apartment the ideal place to recharge after a fresh seafood smorgasbord or a rousing Red Sox victory. Your historic Garrison Street building embodies the charm and character of Back Bay, featuring a landscaped courtyard and expansive rooftop barbecue area - perfect for grilling up something to accompany your chowdah. We believe in personal space. Prior to your arrival, your unit will be professionally cleaned and your self guided check in process ensures easy arrival with no long lines. Should
neighborhood_overview: An oasis of tranquility and calm among Boston’s busy business center, Back Bay is filled with cozy brownstones and tree-lined streets. This family-friendly neighborhood is a local favorite and is centrally located, so with a plethora of things to do nearby, do you really have to explore any further? Within a mile of Boston Medical Center Boston Public Garden Boston Symphony Hall Charles Playhouse Copley Square Fenway Park Mistral Prudential Center Skywalk Observatory Top of the Hub
notes: You will receive your check in instructions from Stay Alfred via email 3 days prior to arrival. Please contact us directly with any questions. Enjoy your stay!
transit: NA
access: Your historic Garrison Street building embodies the charm and character of Back Bay, featuring a landscaped courtyard and expansive rooftop barbecue area - perfect for grilling up something to accompany your chowdah.
interaction: We believe in personal space. Prior to your arrival, your unit will be professionally cleaned and your self guided check in process ensures easy arrival with no long lines. Should you need us, we’re here 24/7 with our guest services team and local folks on the ground. And if you don’t need us, we’ll stay out of your way. After all, this is your place in the city.
house_rules: 1. You’re living like a local, be respectful of the other locals. We mean, c’mon, how would you feel if your neighbor wasn’t super awesome?  2. All of our Rental Units are smoke-free environments. Even on the balcony, if you have one. We’re super sorry if this is a bummer, but it’s our policy. Hopefully we told you about it ahead of time and you aren’t super surprised that we still mean it.  3. Pets are super awesome, but they aren’t allowed in our Rental Units. However, if your fur kiddo is a service animal or an emotional support animal, give us a call and we will make reasonable efforts to accommodate your needs, as required by law.   4. Your trip details should already be complete. If they aren’t, give us a call ASAP so we can rectify that! What’s a little information between friends?   5. Your friend, your responsibility. Pretty simple, if you invite them to your Rental Unit, you’re responsible for their actions.   6. While watching a million people get out of a clown car is hilar
host_about:
Stay Alfred was created based on the idea of offering short term rentals at an unbelievable price while making the booking process easy and problem free. Stay Alfred acquires properties in high-end buildings and condominiums in the best locations to ensure your stay is satisfying and you want to come back. Since we value your return business, we always offer discounts to those who stay in any of our units time after time. We want you to feel at home when you stay with us and that’s why you will always be greeted with a professionally cleaned unit and quality furnishings. We welcome feedback in any kind of way to ensure we are meeting the needs of everyone!

best,
Jordan Allen
Owner

We cater to:

Urban Vacations
Family Travel
Corporate Housing
Extended stay In Denver, Seattle, and Portland
Insurance and Job Relocation
Events and Weddings 
Military Training and PCS
Government Workers
Pet Friendly Vacationers

Hopefully we told you about it ahead of time and you aren’t super surprised that we still mean it.  3. Pets are super awesome, but they aren’t allowed in our Rental Units. However, if your fur kiddo is a service animal or an emotional support animal, give us a call and we will make reasonable efforts to accommodate your needs, as required by law.   4. Your trip details should already be complete. If they aren’t, give us a call ASAP so we can rectify that! What’s a little information between friends?   5. Your friend, your responsibility. space: The building’s historic 19th century façade, its 21st century amenities, intimate courtyard, and landscaped gardens, is truly a home away from home for the most refined traveler. Our 24 hour customer service, concierge service, controlled-access parking and your proximity to the T’s Orange and Green lines makes this the only place to stay on your next trip to Boston!

summary: This cozy 1 Bedroom is located in the beautiful St. Botolph neighborhood. The neighborhood lies between the South End and the Back Bay.  This wonderful little apartment is an excellent place from which to explore the city. It is a small but very efficient 1 Bedroom apartment with an additional sleeper sofa in the living space.
space: The building has been fully renovated and is in immaculate condition. While the apartment is a small 1 Bedroom, it is very efficiently laid out. neighborhood_overview: You are staying in the St. Botolph neighborhood. This charming Victorian collection of rowhouses borders the Back Bay, the South End and the Fenway. Walk into the South End and you will find a charming collection of rowhouses with small parks. The architecture of the area may remind you of London, as the urban design was inspired by the residential districts developed in Mayfair and Notting Hill in the 1850s and 1860s. There is an array of wonderful restaurants and bars in this area. The Back Bay and its Parisian architecture can be reached by walking north across Huntington Avenue and through the Prudential Center. The Back Bay was once comprised of tidal flats and, in a massive effort that created more than 450 acres of useable new land, was filled in over the span of about 40 years starting in the 1850s. Today, the Back Bay is of the most prestigious residential, retail, and office neighborhoods in the City, and offers myriad options for shopping, dining, and sightseeing.
notes: NA
transit: In addition to getting around by walking, Boston city taxis, and Uber, you will be able to use the subway (the “T”) to access other parts of Boston. Below is a brief summary of the subway lines nearby. Green Line. Take a left out the front door, walk down Cumberland and take a right on Huntington. At the next intersection cross West Newton and you will see the entrance to the Green Line station. This will take you into downtown Boston or the outbound will take you to the Symphony and the Museum of Fine Arts. Orange Line. Take a left out the front door. Take another left onto St. Botolph. Walk until you hit Massachusetts Avenue. Take a left and you will see the Massachusetts Avenue station of the Orange Line. This line will take you to Downtown and connects to the Blue Line and the airport as well as the North End and Charlestown.

name: Best of neighborhood feel and city access
summary: Live in a delightful neighborhood with Victorian brownstones steps from all the city amenities.  Inside it's contemporary and serene.  Outside the streetscape is circa 1880, with brick sidewalks and residential buildings of three to six stories.  Subways, commercial services and regional rail lines  are nearby.
space: NA
description: Live in a delightful neighborhood with Victorian brownstones steps from all the city amenities.  Inside it's contemporary and serene.  Outside the streetscape is circa 1880, with brick sidewalks and residential buildings of three to six stories.  Subways, commercial services and regional rail lines  are nearby. You will have exclusive use of the entire unit:  2 bedrooms, bath, laundry, kitchen, living room, and garden/patio. I live in the building and, as available, am happy to help or greet per the guest's wishes. We've got the advantages of a low-traffic dead-end street while being just two blocks from the Prudential Center.  We're a hybrid of two larger, adjacent neighborhoods:  the Back Bay and the South End,  in a special neighborhood named for the street that forms its backbone:  St. Botolph St.  Each property has a garden in front.  The sidewalks are planted with either flowering pear or cherry trees based on the city planning concept for the street.   We're adjacent to two park
neighborhood_overview: We've got the advantages of a low-traffic dead-end street while being just two blocks from the Prudential Center.  We're a hybrid of two larger, adjacent neighborhoods:  the Back Bay and the South End,  in a special neighborhood named for the street that forms its backbone:  St. Botolph St.  Each property has a garden in front.  The sidewalks are planted with either flowering pear or cherry trees based on the city planning concept for the street.   We're adjacent to two parks, the Southwest Corridor Park and Titus Sparrow Park.  The back of the house looks over green space and a wide, paved alley. All amenities are nearby:  two malls, storefront shops, fine and casual restaurants, and public transportation.  The Welcome Letter on site gives an overview of local restaurants as well as street parking regulations.
notes: Internet/TV:  Wifi and accessible router ports for wired access are provided.  Comcast Performance Pro provides download speeds up to 150 Mbps.  52" TV with Digital Economy 100+ Channels via cable including Showtime and Streampix.   Voice activated remote.  Smart TV can access Netflix (with your subscription), YouTube, and more. Nearly all lights are on dimmers. USB ports throughout and especially in key locations. The laptop/work space is the large black quartz counter shown between the kitchen and living room.  For comfort, choose between the stools that are out and folding ones (that I happen to prefer). The kitchen is well-outfitted with a gas stove and an assortment of knives and cooking containers.  A coffee maker, tea pot, coffee, and tea are provided as well as snacks to cover those who don't have time to pick up something, especially their first night. This building houses professionals who are busy and quiet.  We request that our guests are also quiet.
transit: It's a short walk to two subway lines (Green/E [Prudential stop] and Orange [Mass Ave or Back Bay]) as well as commuter rail and Amtrak regional rail service both at Back Bay Station.  The subway and commuter rail, run by the Massachusetts Bay Transportation Authority, MBTA, uses an encircled T as its logo.  Typically, wait time for an Uber/Lyft is 2 minutes. Parking is very limited without a resident parking sticker, but people do find options.  There's a compilation of street regs by location in the welcome letter on site.  Pay garages are nearby.  (Website hidden by Airbnb) search Durham St., may provide discounts and direction.
access: You will have exclusive use of the entire unit:  2 bedrooms, bath, laundry, kitchen, living room, and garden/patio.
interaction: I live in the building and, as available, am happy to help or greet per the guest's wishes.
house_rules: This is a very quiet building and neighborhood.   Please consider this option only if your party matches up with that. Primary renters must be 25 years of age or older.  Exceptions may be made if a guest in the party who is over 25 takes responsibility.  Other exceptions may be possible upon request.  An additional cleaning fee may apply if the age profile of the group is on the margin. All guests must supply copies of their government-issued photo ID which will be checked upon arrival. Guests are expected to dispose of food properly.  Pots and dishes should be washed or loaded into the dishwasher and set to run.
host_about: I'm a database application developer and also own three rentals in the brownstone where I live.

space: Now you can truly live like a local in our newly furnished Go Local suites! All of the furniture, artwork, and housewares have all been sourced locally and are all 100% made in the United States! All of the lamps in the apartment were made in California and are beautifully intricate, yet simple. Get an amazing night's sleep on our brand new mattresses, set into beautiful wooden bed frames. Our high-thread count linens and MyPillow pillows on every bed assures a peaceful, comfortable, and restful retreat from a hard day of work. The entryway hints at exclusivity and once you enter the recently re-done courtyards you'll see why this is one of a kind living in downtown. The courtyard has fountains, gardens, benches, and more it's a retreat from the hustle and bustle of downtown Boston--you will feel like a true "Bostonian."

name: One Bedroom in Boston Back Bay #310
summary: 1 Bedroom in Brownstone with beautiful gardens and newly furnished.  Close to shopping and Copley Square.  All of the furniture, artwork, and housewares have all been sourced locally and are all 100% made in the United States!
space: All of the furniture is high quality craftsmanship and there are some beautiful, custom items that were made just for us - the knife sets and cutting boards are all hand-made with beautiful wood; the paper towel holders were inspired by the Iron Works right here in MA and the toasters were custom made as well! All of the lamps in the apartment were made in California and are beautifully intricate, yet simple. Get an amazing night's sleep on our brand new mattresses, set into beautiful wooden bed frames. Our high-thread count linens and MyPillow pillows on every bed assures a peaceful, comfortable, and restful retreat from a hard day of work. In fact, you will want to get your own MyPillow after sleeping on one of ours!

summary: At this Sonder, you'll love bright and inviting living space, sleek wood floor, and beautiful kitchen with modern appliances. Located in Boston's Back Bay neighborhood, known for its beautiful riverside views and exquisite restaurants.
space: NA
description: At this Sonder, you'll love bright and inviting living space, sleek wood floor, and beautiful kitchen with modern appliances. Located in Boston's Back Bay neighborhood, known for its beautiful riverside views and exquisite restaurants. Boston’s Back Bay is known for its lovely rows of Victorian houses, river-side walkways, fashionable shops, and delectable restaurants. Enjoy the historic charm and Paris-inspired landscape built from what use to be a true bay, and is now filled with acres of land and residential neighborhoods. Locals promote an active lifestyle and are often seen jogging along the Charles River Esplanade or indulging in pick-up games during the day. While at night, popular bars and restaurants are quick to fill up along the picturesque tree-lined streets. Your Sonder's keys will be found in a lockbox and we'll be sending you detailed access information three days before your stay. If you need any help, just give us a call. This Sonder does not have air conditioning, but

house_rules: House Rules 1. All bookings require a security deposit of $300 or more. You will not be charged for this in advance. 2. Guests can cancel within 24 hours of booking and receive a full refund, or cancel anytime up to seven days before the start of your trip and receive a 50% refund. Trips cancelled fewer than seven days in advance are not eligible for refunds. If you cancel within 24 hours of booking, please reach out to our team, as this refund has to be processed manually.   3. Check-in time is any time after 4 pm. Check-out time is any time before 11 am. You're welcome to request an early check in or late checkout, but this is not guaranteed and we can only confirm 24 hours in advance. 4. We do not allow smoking of any kind, including but not limited to nicotine, tobacco derived products and/or cannabis derived substances; breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine. 5. Most of our locations do not allow pets. 6. Generally, parties or excessive noise are not allowed in our locations. I
host_about: Sonder is reimagining the way people travel. Now in 20+ cities, we’ve been featured in The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, and named 2019’s most innovative hospitality brand by Fast Company. We’ve taken the best parts of home and hotel and combined them into an entirely new experience. All of our spaces are uniquely designed, have 24/7 guest support, and contain all the essentials you need for an impeccable stay. No matter what you’re looking for, there’s a Sonder for you.

name: Back Bay Beacon Three Bedroom Bi-Level Suite
summary: Back Bay Beacon on is one of several Inn Boston Reservations furnished rentals. Perfect for families, couples and business travelers alike, enjoy a stroll down picturesque Commonwealth Avenue or go shopping on world famous Newbury Street, called by many the Rodeo Drive of Boston. Filled with high-end international designer label shops, art galleries, restaurants, and more, Newbury Street is a great place to spot a celebrity or a local sport star while window shopping.
space: Each suite is equipped with cooking, dining, and silverware. Extra linens and towels are provided in the suites as well as toilet paper and toiletries. Laundry facilities are located on the first floor Guests will need to call the office to receive the laundry room code. The Back Bay Beacon has elevator access on the first floor.

The Back Bay Beacon is equipped with a keyless, self-check-in system to allow guests a sense of security and independence during their stay. The staff @ Inn Boston Reservations will create custom
neighborhood_overview: NA
notes: An additional queen size air bed can be accommodated in the living room for an additional flat fee of $150 per stay.  Pack N' Plays are available for no additional cost. A 24-hour notice should be provided if an air mattress is needed.
transit: Commute like a local using Boston's infamous MBTA system. Arlington Green Line Station and Boylston St Green Line Station are located a short walk away. We recommend purchasing weekly passes for 3+ night stays if guests are planning on using the subway or bus system often. Check Boston's MBTA website for prices and subway maps.  Remember to always check street signs and meters if you are planning on driving in. We highly recommend parking at a local garage and leaving your car there until you are ready to go. Parking in Boston can be very complicated and expensive.
access: The Back Bay Beacon is equipped with a keyless, self-check-in system to allow guests a sense of security and independence during their stay. The staff @ Inn Boston Reservations will create custom codes for guests entire stay three days before their arrival date and send them via email.
interaction: Staff is physically available during office hours to assist with any questions or issues. However, our office is located off-site but within a short commuting distance of the property. Our communication is typically via email, phone or booking site.  Our sister hotel assists with overnight calls and emergencies.
house_rules: NA
host_about:
Inn Boston Reservations is a central reservation and property management service located in Boston, Massachusetts. IBR provides corporate housing, vacation rentals and fully furnished apartments in premier locations throughout the City including Back Bay, Beacon Hill, Copley Square, South End, Bay Village and Newbury Street. Each suite is uniquely appointed and carefully selected to provide convenience to public transportation, shopping and historic sites.

Amenities include keyless entry, free wireless internet, cable television and local telephone service. Some units feature roof decks, fire places, multiple bathrooms and laundry facilities.

IBR easily accommodates business and corporate travel or people vacationing with friends and family. Furnished apartments range is size from studios, 1, 2 and 3 bedroom apartments. Each flat is located in a historic brownstone or a brick townhouse. Our guests enjoy a comfortable and safe surrounding with privacy and the convenience of knowing we are just a phone call away.

For more information on Inn Boston Reservations, please visit us (Email hidden by Airbnb)

name: Sunny Spot on St Botolph!
summary: This gorgeous, first floor, one bed is in a fabulous location! It is right across from the Boston landmark, the Prudential Center. It is near the iconic Newbury Street, where you can dine and shop. It is also in walking distance to the historic Boston Commons and Public Garden. It is there where you get some great photos , or follow the Freedom Trail. This one bedroom apartment will make your Boston experience even better!
space: Modern and chic decor- this unit has hardwood floors and  high ceilings. Separate kitchen with dishwasher, microwave, large pantry and tons of cabinets! Common laundry machine laundry for use during your stay available just a few floors below! Must be able to climb stairs.

name: Cozy bedroom in the heart of Backbay in Boston.
summary: From The Esplanade that edges the Charles River to the Brownstones that line its refined streets, Boston's Back Bay rises above the rest when it comes to sought-after sophistication. The neighborhood ages with grace, and the elemental weathering of its Copper-coated facades lends Back Bay its stately appearance. This is a penthouse on the 4th floor of an old brownstone building. There are 5 private bedrooms in different sizes. Shared areas are a living room, kitchen,  and 1.5 bathrooms.
space: This place is not for everyone. This is not a hotel.  There is no breakfast. This is a modest & cozy place in a prime location in the heart of Boston. You cannot beat this location. We worked extremely hard to secure this location. It is not fancy. it's an old brownstone building but it has its charm. It only has the bare necessities. People love it because it is practical and functional. Upon booking, you will get the self check in instructions.  You will be asked if you understand every step to find your room. Your room is equipped with a large bed, a desk, and desk lamp. You will be sharing the common areas (living room, kitchen and bathrooms) with other guests just like you. Your room will have fresh sheets, & a towel. The common areas are cleaned frequently but we cannot control what other guests do in regards to cleanliness, so please set expectations right. However we take things seriously and do our best to keep the common areas comfortable to everyone and we encourage you to m

neighborhood_overview: Boston's diverse mix of residents converge on Newbury Street, one of the city's favorite destinations for boutique shopping, casual people-watching, and urban promenading.  On Newbury Street, stores occupy the bottom-floors of the neighborhood's iconic Brownstones. When you're looking for familiar indoor shopping, take a brief walk to The Prudential Center. This cleanly-styled mall boasts over 75 high-end retailers. Saks Fifth Avenue, Lord & Taylor, Lacoste, Club Monaco, Sephora? Whether lunching, brunching, or evening snacking, Back Bay's mix of cafes, steakhouses, tapas bars, and trendy lounges leave patrons with a good taste in their mouths.
notes: Please note that we put a lot of effort and sweat in running this airbnb, and while this is a great gig, we would like you to have an unforgettable experience.
transit: Our apartment is located 2 min walk from Fenway/Kenmore square, Public transportation, and the convention centers.  Back Bay continues to attract attention for its famed high-end shopping, ritzy hotels and upscale restaurants, and world-renowned architecture—all promising that this highly-sought after neighborhood’s popularity continues to rise, even if its water levels don’t.
access: As guests you have access to the kitchen where we ask you to use it to do light meals only. You have access to the living room and bathrooms.  While our rules of the house are pretty clear regarding respect and cleanliness, we ask you to tell us as soon as something bothers you in the common area. Sometimes we cannot control what other guests do in the sharing areas, but we will do our best to follow up on a timely manner.
interaction: The major interaction will be with the cohost who will be there to answer your messages and make sure your experience is excellent.
house_rules: - 1. Quiet hours in the shared areas are from 10 pm to 7 am - 2. No shoes in the house - 3. Communication of arrival time is a must, and double confirming with the host through the airbnb messaging platform about the readiness of your room is a MUST. Please any show ups to the appartment that is not scheduled will be treated as a violation. - 4. Check out is at 9 am. This is important because the cleaning team needs to come to fix the room for the next guest. Kindly respect that.  - 5. There are extra fees with additional non booked guests.  - 6. Leave the keys of the (self check in process) in the master lock and under the mat. This is EXTREMELY important, please. -7. We do have a flexible check in but this means that guests can leave their luggages in the common area while waiting for the previous guest to check out (usually at 9 am) and the cleaning team to clean the room. We want to make it so smooth for the guests, and we would appreciate your cooperation on informing us about you

name: Stunning 2BR in Back Bay by Sonder
summary: At this Sonder, you'll love the beautiful architectural details, expansive windows, and sleek fully-equipped kitchen. Located in the Back Bay neighborhood, near river-side walkways and excellent restaurants.
space: NA
description: At this Sonder, you'll love the beautiful architectural details, expansive windows, and sleek fully-equipped kitchen. Located in the Back Bay neighborhood, near river-side walkways and excellent restaurants. Boston’s Back Bay is known for its lovely rows of Victorian houses, river-side walkways, fashionable shops, and delectable restaurants. Enjoy the historic charm and Paris-inspired landscape built from what use to be a true bay, and is now filled with acres of land and residential neighborhoods. Locals promote an active lifestyle and are often seen jogging along the Charles River Esplanade or indulging in pick-up games during the day. While at night, popular bars and restaurants are quick to fill up along the picturesque tree-lined streets. Your Sonder's keys will be found in a lockbox and we'll be sending you detailed access information three days before your stay. If you need any help, just give us a call. This Sonder is a 2nd floor walk-up with stair access only, and no elevator.
neighborhood_overview: Boston’s Back Bay is known for its lovely rows of Victorian houses, river-side walkways, fashionable shops, and delectable restaurants. Enjoy the historic charm and Paris-inspired landscape built from what use to be a true bay, and is now filled with acres of land and residential neighborhoods. notes: Your Sonder's keys will be found in a lockbox and we'll be sending you detailed access information three days before your stay. If you need any help, just give us a call. This Sonder is a 2nd floor walk-up with stair access only, and no elevator. This Sonder doesn't have laundry facilities. However, there is a well-reviewed Back Bay Laundromat within walking distance. One of the bedrooms in this space is not completely closed.  It is a walk-through bedroom with a clear glass door. Smoking is strictly prohibited in this Sonder and elsewhere on the property, including the front steps. Fireplace usage is strictly prohibited.

access: NA
interaction: NA
house_rules: House Rules 1. All bookings require a security deposit of $300 or more. You will not be charged for this in advance. 2. Guests can cancel within 24 hours of booking and receive a full refund, or cancel anytime up to seven days before the start of your trip and receive a 50% refund. Trips cancelled fewer than seven days in advance are not eligible for refunds. If you cancel within 24 hours of booking, please reach out to our team, as this refund has to be processed manually.   3. Check-in time is any time after 4 pm. Check-out time is any time before 11 am. You're welcome to request an early check in or late checkout, but this is not guaranteed and we can only confirm 24 hours in advance. 4. We do not allow smoking of any kind, including but not limited to nicotine, tobacco derived products and/or cannabis derived substances; breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine. 5. Most of our locations do not allow pets. 6. Generally, parties or excessive noise are not allowed in our locations. I
host_about: Sonder is reimagining the way people travel. Now in 20+ cities, we’ve been featured in The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, and named 2019’s most innovative hospitality brand by Fast Company. We’ve taken the best parts of home and hotel and combined them into an entirely new experience. All of our spaces are uniquely designed, have 24/7 guest support, and contain all the essentials you need for an impeccable stay. No matter what you’re looking for, there’s a Sonder for you.

neighborhood_overview: The landscape of Back Bay was inspired by Paris; browsing shop-lined Newbury Street, dining at sidewalk cafés, and strolling along the Commonwealth Avenue Mall all channel the City of Lights. Originally the site of a true bay, early city planners filled in hundreds of acres of tidal flats to create this unique residential district, which has represented elegant living in Boston since the turn of the last century.   The cluster of restaurants, shops, and cultural institutions centered in the Back Bay speak to its prime position within the city. Yet the area maintains a residential feel, with apartments perched amid Newbury Street boutiques. Back Bay residents have the city at their fingertips, from morning strolls past the willow-draped ponds of the Public Garden to evenings of outdoor dinners on Newbury Street and performances at Symphony Hall.
notes: please pay attention to the bed size and mattress dimension. might not be suitable for very tall guest About noise: Back Bay neighborhood is one of the oldest neighborhood in the United State, which means all the brownstone are at least 100 years old, with poor sound insolation between units. I have personally lived in several different brownstone buildings in the neighborhood, this apartment is one of the quieter one. Apartment located on a dead end street with sound prove windows, but guest can sometimes hear noise from neighbors due to the age of the building.  Please do not book, if absolute quiet is required.  About Parking: There are numbers of garage within walking distance to the apartment, which includes: Copley garage, Prudential garage, Hynes auditorium garage, Christian Science Church garage, 102 Belvidere St Garage, please try the app called “Best Parking”, simply input your drop off and pick up time, it will show the pricing for all garages nearby!
transit: City central location, there are so many buses and subway stations. Guest can get to anywhere they need through public transportation nearby. Transit score 100, the highest.
