I'm a traveling globetrotter, real estate professional, homeowner, mother of a toddler, and also a neat freak.

I have being renting through Airbnb for 1.5 years, and really enjoyed hosting people from all walks of life. And I profoundly appreciate the extra income I was able to generate to pay for childcare. 

What differentiate me and other hosts on airbnb is: I truly care about a guest's experience especially when it comes to cleanliness and how easy it is to check in/out. I only use pure white linens and towels, and only hire the priciest/best cleaning crew in town. 

My units are priced 20% lower than other Airbnb's in the area, and at least 50% lower than surrounding hotels. Please be considerate when using AC and leave the apartment in a manageable condition to help me keep the cost low.

neighborhood_overview: The landscape of Back Bay was inspired by Paris; browsing shop-lined Newbury Street, dining at sidewalk cafés, and strolling along the Commonwealth Avenue Mall all channel the City of Lights. Originally the site of a true bay, early city planners filled in hundreds of acres of tidal flats to create this unique residential district, which has represented elegant living in Boston since the turn of the last century.   The cluster of restaurants, shops, and cultural institutions centered in the Back Bay speak to its prime position within the city. Yet the area maintains a residential feel, with apartments perched amid Newbury Street boutiques. Back Bay residents have the city at their fingertips, from morning strolls past the willow-draped ponds of the Public Garden to evenings of outdoor dinners on Newbury Street and performances at Symphony Hall.
notes: Car needs to be backed into the parking space in order to get out easily. About noise: Back Bay neighborhood is one of the oldest neighborhood in the United State, which means all the brownstone are at least 100 years old, with poor sound insolation between units. I have personally lived in several different brownstone buildings in the neighborhood, this apartment is one of the quieter one. Apartment located on a dead end street with sound prove windows, but guest can sometimes hear noise from neighbors due to the age of the building.  Please do not book, if absolute quiet is required
transit: so many subway station and buses, please simply use map app for navigation

notes: More about me: I'm a PhD student at MIT and work as a research assistant. Would likely spend most of a typical week day working in school. I cook often and would really appreciate a guest with a high standard of cleanliness.
transit: This apartment is served by the Copley stop on the green line T.  Back Bay is the most walkable part of Boston, from the apartment, you can walk to the shops on Newbury, the Boston Common and Public Gardens, the Charles River or take the T (subway/metro) to downtown. The #1 bus is a short walk, and it takes you to MIT and Harvard.

space: Visiting Boston for work or pleasure, you will love staying in this well appointed 3 bedroom apartment, centrally located in an absolutely PRIME location! You can expect a clean and thoughtfully outfitted space and attentive hosts.Your home away from home will have everything you need to relax and have a wonderful time visiting Boston. This apartment has 3 bedrooms, each with a queen size bed. Additionally, there is a fold away twin size cot and an extra high twin airbed that can be set up in either bedroom.  Although there is no formal living room, one bedroom has a sitting area for 2 complete with TV and basic cable and there is a large kitchen with seating for six.  The eat in kitchen has gas cooking, plenty of counter space, a dishwasher, and space for six at the dining table. You will have all the pots, pans, cooking essentials, plates, and wine glasses you'll need to make home cooked meals (or just a cup of coffee!). Coffee, tea, sugar and non dairy creamer are all provided for y

neighborhood_overview: History buffs! Bay Village is nestled between Back Bay and the South End neighborhoods.  Architecturally, many Bay Village homes look like smaller versions of Beacon Hill townhouses. This is largely because many of the craftspeople who built the Beacon Hill residences settled in this area and built the local residences for their own use. The neighborhood is comprised of numerous houses dating from the Federal Period and  Grander five-story townhouses in the Greek Revival style as well as in the Victorian style. Most of the sidewalks are paved with brick, and are lit by gas street lamps at night. One small street is still paved with original cobblestones. Literary buffs! The American writer Edgar Allen Poe was born in Bay Village; his parents were actors in the nearby theater district. Look for the bronze sculpture "Poe Returning to Boston" which depicts a life-sized Poe striding against the wind, accompanied by a flying raven; his suitcase lid has fallen open, leaving a "paper trail" o
notes: When booking, please tell us about yourself and what brings you to Boston. We ask that you have finished the Airbnb verification process by verifying one social media account and scanning your offline ID. Go to www.airbnb.com/verify for more info. Ask us about free luggage storage in the building.
transit: Walkers rejoice! Bay Village has a walk score of 98 (Boston is considered the third most walkable city in the US) and a transit score of 100. The Orange and Green line subway trains are nearby.  On-street parking is scarce within Bay Village but  there are numerous surface lots and parking garages located near or in the neighborhood. Entrance ramps to the Massachusetts Turnpike (I-90) and the Central Artery (I-93) are a minute's drive away. Easy access to/from Logan airport by car, taxi/uber/lyft or subway.
access: Complete access to the entire apartment. Completely private, not a shared space.  Upon entering the building, you'll pass through the foyer into the common hall and go up one flight of stairs to the apartment. You'll have full access to apartment, which is stocked with essential toiletries, towels and linens. An iron, ironing board, and hair dryer are all available for your use. We are happy to provide medium roast ground coffee, sugar and non dairy creamer.  The heat is controlled by the buildings management, we can alert them if you are chilly or too warm but cannot guarantee any temperatures.
interaction: If our paths cross, terrific! Otherwise we will give you your privacy so you can enjoy your stay. We are always available by email, text and phone.
house_rules: - Quiet in the common halls and respectful  of our neighbors. We ask shoes be removed, slippers are provided. No smoking in the apartments, in the common halls or within 50 feet of the exterior of the building.
host_about: Hello! We are Liesl and Drew, your Boston hosts. Longtime Boston residents, we are committed to providing a five star experience during your visit. We love to share our insider tips for where to go, what to see and what to eat and where to eat it. Looking forward to welcoming you to our fair city!

description: Stay Alfred’s latest Boston vacation rental combines the warmth and charm of nineteenth century architecture with twenty-first century amenities. At the crossroads of two historical neighborhoods, you will be a short walk from Back Bay’s fashionable shops and the South End’s hip restaurants and galleries. Featuring a historic brick facade and wrought-iron details, the interior boasts every modern convenience, from a full kitchen to in-unit laundry. The spacious layout and stylish decor make this apartment the ideal place to recharge after a fresh seafood smorgasbord or a rousing Red Sox victory. Your historic Garrison Street building embodies the charm and character of Back Bay, featuring a landscaped courtyard and expansive rooftop barbecue area - perfect for grilling up something to accompany your chowdah. We believe in personal space. Prior to your arrival, your unit will be professionally cleaned and your self guided check in process ensures easy arrival with no long lines. Should
neighborhood_overview: An oasis of tranquility and calm among Boston’s busy business center, Back Bay is filled with cozy brownstones and tree-lined streets. This family-friendly neighborhood is a local favorite and is centrally located, so with a plethora of things to do nearby, do you really have to explore any further? Within a mile of Boston Medical Center Boston Public Garden Boston Symphony Hall Charles Playhouse Copley Square Fenway Park Mistral Prudential Center Skywalk Observatory Top of the Hub
notes: You will receive your check in instructions from Stay Alfred via email 3 days prior to arrival. Please contact us directly with any questions. Enjoy your stay!

access: Your historic Garrison Street building embodies the charm and character of Back Bay, featuring a landscaped courtyard and expansive rooftop barbecue area - perfect for grilling up something to accompany your chowdah.
interaction: We believe in personal space. Prior to your arrival, your unit will be professionally cleaned and your self guided check in process ensures easy arrival with no long lines. Should you need us, we’re here 24/7 with our guest services team and local folks on the ground. And if you don’t need us, we’ll stay out of your way. After all, this is your place in the city.
house_rules: 1. You’re living like a local, be respectful of the other locals. We mean, c’mon, how would you feel if your neighbor wasn’t super awesome?  2. All of our Rental Units are smoke-free environments. Even on the balcony, if you have one. We’re super sorry if this is a bummer, but it’s our policy. Hopefully we told you about it ahead of time and you aren’t super surprised that we still mean it.  3. Pets are super awesome, but they aren’t allowed in our Rental Units. However, if your fur kiddo is a service animal or an emotional support animal, give us a call and we will make reasonable efforts to accommodate your needs, as required by law.   4. Your trip details should already be complete. If they aren’t, give us a call ASAP so we can rectify that! What’s a little information between friends?   5. Your friend, your responsibility. Pretty simple, if you invite them to your Rental Unit, you’re responsible for their actions.   6. While watching a million people get out of a clown car is hilar
host_about:
Stay Alfred was created based on the idea of offering short term rentals at an unbelievable price while making the booking process easy and problem free. Stay Alfred acquires properties in high-end buildings and condominiums in the best locations to ensure your stay is satisfying and you want to come back. Since we value your return business, we always offer discounts to those who stay in any of our units time after time. We want you to feel at home when you stay with us and that’s why you will always be greeted with a professionally cleaned unit and quality furnishings. We welcome feedback in any kind of way to ensure we are meeting the needs of everyone!

best,
Jordan Allen
Owner

name: The Boston Newbury Two Bedroom Suite
summary: The Boston Newbury is one of several Inn Boston Reservations furnished rentals. Located at the heart of Boston’s Back Bay, The Newbury offers easy access to Boston’s best shopping and attractions, including the Hynes Convention Center, the Prudential Center shopping mall, and Boston’s famous Newbury Street. The Boston Newbury is one of several brownstones in the neighborhood, equipped with a keyless, self-check-in system to allow guests a sense of security and independence during their stay.  The perfect location for families, couples and business travelers alike!
space: Two bedroom apartment with stand up shower, living room and kitchen. Each suite is equipped with cooking, dining, and silverware. Extra linens and towels are provided in the suites as well as toilet paper and toiletries.  The Boston Newbury does not have elevator access. Guests are to use the stairs to get to their suite and to enter/exit the building. Guests should contact the office ahead of time if this is an issue.

Guests should contact the office ahead of time if this is an issue. The Bo
neighborhood_overview: Located right off of Newbury St, minutes from Hynes Convention Center and public transportation. The Boston Newbury is the perfect location for shopping, dining, and site seeing. Fenway Park is located about a 30 minute walk away, the subway and bus stops within a 5 minute walking distance.
notes: An additional air bed can be accommodated in the living room of the suite for an additional set fee of $150 per stay. A 24 hour notice must be provided if an additional bed is needed. Pack N' Plays are available for no additional cost. A 24-hour notice should be provided if an air mattress is needed.
transit: Commute like a local using Boston's infamous MBTA system. Hynes Convention Center Green Line Stop and Copley Square Green Line Stop are located a short walk away. We recommend purchasing weekly passes for 3+ night stays if guests are planning on using the subway or bus system often. Check Boston's MBTA website for prices and subway maps.  Remember to always check street signs and meters if you are planning on driving in. We highly recommend parking at a local garage and leaving your car there until you are ready to go. Parking in Boston can be very complicated and expensive.
access: The Boston Newbury is equipped with a keyless, self-check-in system to allow guests a sense of security and independence during their stay. The staff @ Inn Boston Reservations will create custom codes for guests entire stay three days before their arrival date and send them via email.
interaction: Staff is physically available during office hours to assist with any questions or issues. However, our office is located off-site but within walking distance of the property. Our communication is typically via email, phone or booking site.  Our sister hotel assists with overnight calls and emergencies.
house_rules: NA
host_about:
Inn Boston Reservations is a central reservation and property management service located in Boston, Massachusetts. IBR provides corporate housing, vacation rentals and fully furnished apartments in premier locations throughout the City including Back Bay, Beacon Hill, Copley Square, South End, Bay Village and Newbury Street. Each suite is uniquely appointed and carefully selected to provide convenience to public transportation, shopping and historic sites.

Amenities include keyless entry, free wireless internet, cable television and local telephone service. Some units feature roof decks, fire places, multiple bathrooms and laundry facilities.

IBR easily accommodates business and corporate travel or people vacationing with friends and family. Furnished apartments range is size from studios, 1, 2 and 3 bedroom apartments. Each flat is located in a historic brownstone or a brick townhouse. Our guests enjoy a comfortable and safe surrounding with privacy and the convenience of knowing we are just a phone call away.

For more information on Inn Boston Reservations, please visit us (Email hidden by Airbnb)

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is situated in Back Bay in the heart of Boston, proximate to Charles River, Public Garden, and Boston Common. The neighborhood stands out through the combination of options it offers. Housing many of the cities most well-known office towers, it also offers a wide variety of shopping and dining options. During weekends, established professionals and graduate students, living in the area, head to Newbury Street for upscale shopping and a stroll along the Commonwealth Avenue Mall. The neighborhood is ideal for active, outdoor lovers, as it is only minutes away from the Esplanade and offers ample green space for jogging and biking. North and South Stations are easily accessible by car and public transit, as is the financial district.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
house_rules: - Building amenities may have an extra cost - A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - Same day check-ins are only guaranteed if booking is made before 4 pm - Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions, along with related fees. Guests should notify us of any pets prior to check-in (failing to do so will incur a penalty) - Blueground has the right to enter and inspect the apartment or to show the apartment to a potential tenant any day of the week between 9am and 6pm as long as the tenant has been informed via email at least one day in advance - Please contact us for details

summary: This Room is located in a Modest City Style 2 Bedroom close to Boston Center. Close to EVERYTHING (Fenway Park 6 min away, Harvard Medical & Other Hospitals 10 min away, Boston Commons, Financial District Hynes Convention Center & Restaurants. Train and bus stations, Berklee College of Music & the Prudential Center are within 1 Block walking distance. Top Choice Shopping on Newbury Street just 1 Block away. Even Harvard University & Suffolk is just over the bridge, 10 minutes away!
space: The key to this place is location. This is a hidden gem with true downtown Boston feeling as we are neighbors to business offices. (If anyone asks, you're visiting Nav & Bebe *not AirBnB - don't want the neighbors to feel any unjust concern) Restaurants are right downstairs and there isn't a place in Boston that's worth exploring that you can't get get to within 10 to 20 minutes! 2 Good sized rooms, with Kitchen as common space.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is situated in Back Bay in the heart of Boston, proximate to Charles River, Public Garden, and Boston Common. The neighborhood stands out through the combination of options it offers. Housing many of the cities most well-known office towers, it also offers a wide variety of shopping and dining options. During weekends, established professionals and graduate students, living in the area, head to Newbury Street for upscale shopping and a stroll along the Commonwealth Avenue Mall. The neighborhood is ideal for active, outdoor lovers, as it is only minutes away from the Esplanade and offers ample green space for jogging and biking. North and South Stations are easily accessible by car and public transit, as is the financial district.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
transit: NA
access: NA
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
house_rules: - Building amenities may have an extra cost - A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - Same day check-ins are only guaranteed if booking is made before 4 pm - Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions, along with related fees. Guests should notify us of any pets prior to check-in (failing to do so will incur a penalty) - Parking is offered based on availability and is subject to a fee. - Blueground has the right to enter and inspect the apartment or to show the apartment to a potential tenant any day of the week between 9am and 6pm as long as the tenant has been informed via email at least one day in advance - Please contact us for details

host_about:
Blueground is changing the way the world experiences furnished living.

We take perfectly located apartments and turn them into beautifully-designed and thoughtfully-equipped homes available for stays of 30 days or longer. 

Each Blueground property comes with modern furniture, premium linens, high-speed WiFi, and everything else you need to get up and running from day one.

All backed by our dedicated, on-the-ground support team, Blueground makes finding a new place to call home frictionless. Show up and start living with Blueground today.

Founded in 2013, Blueground is currently present in nine cities around the world and has a portfolio of more than 1500 premium properties... and growing.

host_about:
Inn Boston Reservations is a central reservation and property management service located in Boston, Massachusetts. IBR provides corporate housing, vacation rentals and fully furnished apartments in premier locations throughout the City including Back Bay, Beacon Hill, Copley Square, South End, Bay Village and Newbury Street. Each suite is uniquely appointed and carefully selected to provide convenience to public transportation, shopping and historic sites.

Amenities include keyless entry, free wireless internet, cable television and local telephone service. Some units feature roof decks, fire places, multiple bathrooms and laundry facilities.

IBR easily accommodates business and corporate travel or people vacationing with friends and family. Furnished apartments range is size from studios, 1, 2 and 3 bedroom apartments. Each flat is located in a historic brownstone or a brick townhouse. Our guests enjoy a comfortable and safe surrounding with privacy and the convenience of knowing we are just a phone call away.

For more information on Inn Boston Reservations, please visit us (Email hidden by Airbnb)

name: Spacious and Gorgeous 1 Bedroom Across From Pru
summary: This one bed has a chic, yet homey atmosphere. It is located right across from the Prudential Center, which has great dining and shopping. The famous Newbury Street is just a short walk from here as well. It is located on the Green Line of the T, so the whole of Boston is easily accessible. The Boston Commons and the Boston Public Gardens are also very near by, and allow for picturesque view of Boston and its skyline. This one bed makes a great home no matter how long the stay.
space: Modern and chic decor- this unit has hardwood floors, high ceilings, bow windows, exposed brick and was just newly painted. Separate kitchen with dishwasher, microwave, large pantry and tons of cabinets! Common laundry machine laundry for use during your stay available just a few floors below! Must be able to climb stairs as this is on top floor.

neighborhood_overview: South End’s perfectly manicured parks and couture restaurants and cocktail lounges. Although a ritzy vibe emanates from South End’s classic brownstones, it tempers its upscale atmosphere with down-to-earth residents who happen to shop organically, buy gluten-free biscuits for their pets, and often refer to their neighborhood’s trendy boutiques as ‘fab.’ Conveniently located minutes from Downtown, everything offered by this chic locale is top-notch.
notes: We do not provide parking. Parking in the city can be very tough at times I would suggest that you do your research for garages and parking lots prior to your stay!

name: Back Bay 2 Bedroom Apartments near Fenway Park
summary: The perfect vacation or corporate residence!  Welcome to this classy and spacious townhouse on leafy Commonwealth Avenue. name: Warm ! bedroom Back Bay!! #Bluebird
summary: Superior features including designer kitchens, generous closets and fireplaces enhance these apartment homes. Landscaped gardens and a private courtyard with elegant cast iron fountains, a roof top terrace with skyline views and concierge services are some of the upscale amenities offered at this luxurious community. These apartments are located at the crossroads of Boston’s historic Back Bay and South End neighborhoods and only a short walk from Back Bay's fashionable shops & hip restaurants.
space: The building’s historic 19th century façade, its 21st century amenities, intimate courtyard, and landscaped gardens, is truly a home away from home for the most refined traveler. At the crossroads of two of Boston’s most historically preserved neighborhoods, Back Bay and South End, you are a short walk to high-end shopping, trendy restaurants, art galleries, museums, and Fenway Park. These luxury apartments allow you all the conveniences that come with living in downtown Boston without all the hustle and bustle of city life. Our 24 hour customer service, concierge service, controlled-access parking and your proximity to the T’s Orange and Green lines makes this the only place to stay on your next trip to Boston!

neighborhood_overview: Affluent Back Bay is a shopping, dining and tourist destination! Our apartment is one block away from the Prudential shopping center with dozens of designer stores. Along nearby Newbury Street, you'll find designer boutiques, fashion chains, art galleries and patio cafes set in elegant brick townhouses. Expansive Copley Square is flanked by 1800s landmarks Trinity Church and the Boston Public Library. Mansions dot the neighborhood’s tree-lined streets, many on Paris-inspired Commonwealth Avenue. The Boston Marathon finish line is within walking distance!

name: Spectacular, luxury Bay Village/Back Bay Condo
summary: Welcome to our little gem in one of the most wonderful neighborhoods in Boston called Bay Village.  Tree lined streets with brick sidewalks, traditional brownstones and superb architecture sum up Bay Village. When you walk out the door of the condo - you are just steps away from Back Bay, the South End, the Boston Common and the theatre district.  You are within a short walk of dozens of the best bars and restaurants the city has to offer!  PLEASE READ HOUSE MANUAL BEFORE BOOKING.
space: (PLEASE READ HOUSE MANUAL BEFORE BOOKING)  Our place is a 2 bedroom duplex in a wonderful historic brownstone building.  Downstairs, which is street level, you’ll find a comfortable living room, dining area and kitchen, and half bath.  Up the spiral staircase you’ll find a large master bedroom, guest bedroom, full bath with jacuzzi, and access to a wonderful outdoor space.  We also have a *small* private parking spot for a compact car - if your car is under 72” wide and you are slow and careful, it will fit.

We also have a *small* private parking spot for a compact car - if your car is under 72” wide and you are slow and careful, it will fit.
neighborhood_overview: The Bay Village is the smallest officially recognized neighborhood in Boston.  It sits right at the end of the Back Bay and right before the South End.  It’s a quiet neighborhood literally nestled right in the middle of downtown Boston!
notes: This is NOT a party house - this is one of our HOMES, we love this home and building - and want our guests to treat it as we do.   It will be sparkling clean when you arrive and appreciate it when it’s left similarly.  We have had a couple of guests recently who did not follow any of the house rules - so unfortunately we have had to become much more strict.   SEE HOUSE MANUAL.

access: The only amenities that are off limits are the fireplaces.
interaction: Available any time on cell, text or app!
house_rules: This is a quiet residential building and neighborhood.  We ask that guests respect our home and neighbors and keep noise to a minimum between 9pm and 8am.   Absolutely no large gatherings or parties allowed.  We would also prefer that guests remove their shoes and to keep our home as clean as it is when they arrive.
host_about:
I'm what I'd call a young professional - although growing older every day. I'm married to a great woman and we've got an incredibly cute little daughter. I'm pretty much a work-o-holic.  I love my job -- I currently lead the Worldwide Sales team for a really interesting commercial open source company called Acquia.  Acquia provides support and cloud based platform services for Drupal - which powers over a million websites.

I would classify myself as a "driver." My favorite three words: "Sense of Urgency." I am skewed toward the "right brain" way of thinking. I'm passionate. I work beyond my boiling point at whatever task I'm setting out to achieve. I'm an anxious person. I'm a maverick. I'm a multi-tasker (the guy with two phones in hand, the PDA spitting e-mails and three lines on hold), sometimes to the point where my loved ones think I have ADD. I hate to lose, and rarely do. I love to exercise. I have terrible directional sense and it frustrates my friends and wife - so they just offer to drive now :-) I'm extremely dedicated to my family, relationships, profession and hobbies. Loyalty is something my Father taught me - and it will be forever ingrained in me.

name: Charlesmark, boutique hotel room in Copley Square
summary: Originally built in 1886 as a private residence in the heart of Boston's Back Bay neighborhood, the hotel has been completely renovated. Our European style boutique hotel features a hip cocktail lounge with an outdoor patio. Premier location. Exceptional value. European ambiance. The Charlesmark combines it all to create a memorable lodging experience. Ambiance - Genuine, Intimate Service **Taxes ARE included in your rate** We have a free light Continental breakfast.
space: Our Standard Rooms feature a Full size bed. As we are located in the heart of historic boston our standard rooms are on the smaller size when compared to suburban chain hotels. Your room is located in our Boutique Hotel where every room has a custom sound system, DVD & VHS players featuring our library of classic and modern movies to enjoy throughout your stay.  Just steps away from the "T" (the Boston Subway system) we are within a short walk to many historic places in Boston and a quick trip away from anywhere the city.

Along Newbury Street (one block behind our hotel), locals and visitors frequent designer boutiques, fashion chains, art galleries and patio cafes set in elegant brick townhouses.  To the front of our hotel Copley Square is flanked by 1800s landmarks Trinity Church and the Boston Public Library. Nearby mansions dot the neighborhood’s tree-lined streets, many on Paris-inspired Commonwealth Avenue.
notes: NA
transit: Just steps away from the MBTA's T (subway) "Green Line" you can get to all of boston's ground transportation within just a few minuets. If you are arriving via air, we are directly across from the Massport Logan express which runs daily trips every 20 minutes to and from Logan Airport.
access: Our bar and lounge is open from 5 to midnight or later each day. We have an attached restaurant that features authentic Italian ingredients. The restaurant is open for lunch and dinner. Our handcrafted cocktails are available in our lounge and in the attached restaurant Ora Trattorizza each evening.
interaction: We are on staff 24 hours a day to help you get the most out of your trip to Boston. Need Trolley tickets, a map, personal recommendations? We're here for you.

summary: Beautiful, sunny and spacious apartment in the Historic Back Bay area. Steps and to Hynes Convention Center, Newbury Street, and Boston's world famous Symphony Hall. Fully stocked with all the basics to make your stay comfortable, including laundry!
space: This third floor apartment features a great view of Commonwealth Avenue from the living and dining space. The bedroom is sunny, quiet and comfortable with a queen bed, and I have plenty of towels and linens. The couch is big enough for a nap and pulls out to a sleeper sofa with a queen size mattress. The kitchen is recently updated with stainless steel appliances, including a dishwasher and washer/dryer. I always have coffee and tea supplies at hand, and many pantry basics for those who like to cook!

neighborhood_overview: Back Bay is a historic neighborhood of Boston, filled with 19th-century brownstone rowhouses like this one. Newbury Street, Boston's high-end shopping street, is around the corner. Also around the corner is the Esplanade, a great space for running or sunning or taking in the sailboats on the Charles. You'll be within easy walking distance of museums, restaurants and historic churches.
notes: No late night check-ins please! If you'll be later than 9pm please let us know in the request. Thank you! As with most historical homes in Boston, there is no air conditioning, but the apartment always has a nice cross breeze and fans keep everyone cool. Summer nights are usually in the 60s and I never have any trouble sleeping.
transit: Very close to the Hynes Convention Center stop on the Green Line. The number 1 bus takes you straight to Cambridge, and most of Boston's most beautiful sights are within walking distance. I can't provide parking, but you certainly don't need a car to get around!
access: You'll share the apartment with me. I'm 35, work full time in the tech / startup world. I share the entryway and building with three other tenants, so I ask guests to be quiet and respectful.
interaction: I'm happy to provide tips and suggestions as you plan your trip, and if you have any questions during your stay, I'm just a phone call or text away. I will leave an information sheet and some guidebooks to get you started!

neighborhood_overview: The apartment is in the center of Back Bay, Boston's best preserved historic neighborhood with it's beautiful brownstone buildings and pedestrian friendly streets. Many shops, restaurants and fitness studios are within a 5 minutes walk from the building.
notes: More about me: I'm a PhD student at MIT and work as a research assistant. Would likely spend most of a typical week day working in school. I cook often and would really appreciate a guest with a high standard of cleanliness.
transit: This apartment is served by the Copley stop on the green line T.  Back Bay is the most walkable part of Boston, from the apartment, you can walk to the shops on Newbury, the Boston Common and Public Gardens, the Charles River or take the T (subway/metro) to downtown. The #1 bus is a short walk, and it takes you to MIT and Harvard.
access: You'll have your own private room, and you'll share the kitchen, living room and bathroom with me.
interaction: Feel free to always text me with questions, I'll respond quickly. In the apartment, I'll give you your space as I know travel can be exhausting in itself, but feel free to reach out to me for recommendations, I might also offer to cook a meal for you.
house_rules: Please keep noise to a minimum as a courtesy to neighbors
host_about: Graduate student and a researcher,  love travel and exploration,  mostly spontaneous and last minute.

name: A Boutique Hotel Room in Copley, Charlesmark Hotel
summary: Originally built in 1886 as a private residence in the heart of Boston's Back Bay neighborhood, the hotel has been completely renovated. Our European style boutique hotel features a hip cocktail lounge with an outdoor patio. Premier location. Exceptional value. European ambiance. The Charlesmark combines it all to create a memorable lodging experience. Ambiance - Genuine, Intimate Service **Taxes ARE included in your rate** We have a free light Continental breakfast.
space: Our Standard Rooms feature a Full size bed. As we are located in the heart of historic boston our standard rooms are on the smaller size when compared to suburban chain hotels. Your room is located in our Boutique Hotel where every room has a custom sound system, DVD & VHS players featuring our library of classic and modern movies to enjoy throughout your stay.  Just steps away from the "T" (the Boston Subway system) we are within a short walk to many historic places in Boston and a quick trip away from anywhere the city.

neighborhood_overview: Back Bay is a shopping and dining destination. Along Newbury Street (one block behind our hotel), locals and visitors frequent designer boutiques, fashion chains, art galleries and patio cafes set in elegant brick townhouses.  To the front of our hotel Copley Square is flanked by 1800s landmarks Trinity Church and the Boston Public Library. Nearby mansions dot the neighborhood’s tree-lined streets, many on Paris-inspired Commonwealth Avenue.
notes: NA
transit: Just steps away from the MBTA's T (subway) "Green Line" you can get to all of boston's ground transportation within just a few minuets. If you are arriving via air, we are directly across from the Massport Logan express which runs daily trips every 20 minutes to and from Logan Airport.
access: Our bar and lounge is open from 5 to midnight or later each day. We have an attached restaurant that features authentic Italian ingredients. The restaurant is open for lunch and dinner. Our handcrafted cocktails are available in our lounge and in the attached restaurant Ora Trattorizza each evening.
interaction: We are on staff 24 hours a day to help you get the most out of your trip to Boston. Need Trolley tickets, a map, personal recommendations? We're here for you.
house_rules: Events and parties should be booked ahead of time, please message us for details.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is situated in Back Bay in the heart of Boston, proximate to Charles River, Public Garden, and Boston Common. The neighborhood stands out through the combination of options it offers. Housing many of the cities most well-known office towers, it also offers a wide variety of shopping and dining options. During weekends, established professionals and graduate students, living in the area, head to Newbury Street for upscale shopping and a stroll along the Commonwealth Avenue Mall. The neighborhood is ideal for active, outdoor lovers, as it is only minutes away from the Esplanade and offers ample green space for jogging and biking. North and South Stations are easily accessible by car and public transit, as is the financial district.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
transit: NA
access: NA
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
house_rules: - Building amenities may have an extra cost - A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - Same day check-ins are only guaranteed if booking is made before 4 pm - Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions, along with related fees. Guests should notify us of any pets prior to check-in (failing to do so will incur a penalty) - Blueground has the right to enter and inspect the apartment or to show the apartment to a potential tenant any day of the week between 9am and 6pm as long as the tenant has been informed via email at least one day in advance - Please contact us for details
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
Blueground is changing the way the world experiences furnished living.

We take perfectly located apartments and turn them into beautifully-designed and thoughtfully-equipped homes available for stays of 30 days or longer. 

Each Blueground property comes with modern furniture, premium linens, high-speed WiFi, and everything else you need to get up and running from day one.

All backed by our dedicated, on-the-ground support team, Blueground makes finding a new place to call home frictionless. Show up and start living with Blueground today.

Founded in 2013, Blueground is currently present in nine cities around the world and has a portfolio of more than 1500 premium properties... and growing.

name: Enormous Penthouse Duplex | Unbeatable Location
summary: Hello and thanks for checking out my listing!  My apartment is in the best location, centrally placed- everything is a walk away!  The apartment is a Penthouse duplex in a 122 year old brownstone in the Historic Back Bay! You will not find any apartment as spacious and as uniquely decorated as this!
space: The apartment is located on the third floor of a 3 floor building, you will need to walk up 2.5 fights of stairs.  As soon as you enter you will see the large living room and open kitchen layout, its great for chilling, entertaining, and working! Upstairs on the second floor there are 3 bedrooms, two of which are Master rooms. Oh! I Forgot to mention, theres a deck in the back with great Newbury St. views equipped with a grill and lovely hung lights. The building is 122 years old but has been through renovation, located in the Historic district some aspects of the apartment are nostalgic, such as the 8 pain windows and wrought iron entrance.  If you have any questions at all about the apartment don't hesitate to reach out and ask, I try to get back to my guests as soon as i can, My guests are my priority!

neighborhood_overview: One of Boston’s most visitor-friendly neighborhoods, the Back Bay is a mix of affluent residential streets and commercial attractions. Although it contains some of the city’s most important architectural sights, it’s also Boston’s main shopping destination, where you’ll find everything from global mega-chains to cutting-edge designer boutiques. But it wasn’t always so—roughly 150 years ago, the entire area, from the Public Garden to the Fens, was submerged in swampland; a massive landfill project to meet the needs of a population surge made the area what it is now. Though the neighborhood has a conservative "old Boston" reputation, there’s a number of funky businesses, not to mention a visible student presence.
notes: NA

host_about:
ABOUT ME

In a nutshell: I'm a traveller, researcher, musician, fairly accomplished programmer, avid skier, and a general lover of life and everything to do with it.

In a slightly larger nutshell: I'm Petar. I was born in Cambridge, MA but moved back to Serbia a few months later. Lived there until 1999 when we moved back to the United States. I consider myself very lucky to be a child of two continents - this has allowed me to travel most of the world, and have fantastic times experiencing all of the different cultures, histories, and adventures that our little planet has to offer. I decided to join up on here as I wanted to expand my traveling network, and travel all over the world! For those who stay at my place - I know the Boston area in and out, and would be more than glad to show you what this fantastic city has to offer, and provide great accommodation. 

I'm a collector of memories, not things :)

Why I’m on AirBnB

The world is truly full of amazing people. When I'm not traveling, I'm happy to put up my place - I find it's a great way to travel, meet exceptional people and have fantastic experiences.

Interests

Many of my friends have described me as a renaissance man. If something interests me, I'll usually go out of my way to try it out. Currently, I've been on a bit of a language learning streak - I'm trying to get my German, French, and Italian to fairly passable levels. Thank God my Spanish is up to par!

Other than that, I've become quite interested in Art Deco architecture, and designs from that era. Can anyone say Bahaus?

Professionally, I'm a computer programmer, and a researcher in high performance computing. In this regard my interests, which probably bore pretty much everyone else have to do with efficient memory and cache, multithreaded program design, and all that other fun stuff.

Prudential Offices/Shopping 2 min, Copley Place Mall 3 min, John Hancock, Liberty Mutual-Marathon Finish Line 5 mins away.
space: Be Historic! Your room is large, furnished, air conditioned, and private in a renovated historic Back Bay townhouse. For your health this a non-smoking household. The house built in 1880 is in the Back Bay in the middle of everything Boston. With modern skyscrapers and quaint three story upscale brownstones next door you have the best of both worlds.  This is a great location on a tree lined street in a very exclusive neighborhood. The perfect place for you. This is one of the safest neighborhoods in Boston. We want you to feel comfortable and safe. There are two exits, a fire extinguisher, smoke and fire alarms. You can lock your garden level room door for extra safety and privacy. In-room personal fridge for a late night drink or snack.  This is a lovely clean, safe, quiet place to stay in downtown Boston with video cameras around the property and an in-home security monitoring system. There is a short flight of stairs to go up and down to get to your room. One half hour from Logan A

neighborhood_overview: Friendly street of upscale historic townhouses beautifully restored and maintained. Houses on the street are owner occupied and well loved.  At the end of the street is a public park with a tennis court, concerts, basketball court and kids playground.
notes: The Hynes Convention Center is a 5 minute walk. The Prudential Center Mall and Copley Mall are a short distance away. The Marriott, Hilton, Westin, Copley Plaza and other hotels are minutes away. Parking is available nearby.  Berkeley College of Music, New England Conservatory, Northeastern University and other colleges in the vicinity.  Area hospitals: Children's, Beth Israel, Brigham and New England Deaconess are in the immediate area and easily accessible.  Area attractions include Symphony Hall, the Gardner Museum, the Huntington Theatre and the Museum of Fine Arts. Public transport taxis, commuter rail, Amtrak, buses and the local trains are around the corner. This location is across the street from the world headquarters Christian Science reflecting pool. The reflecting pool is a two story sprinkler with lights nestled across the street from the Prudential Center.   Parking: The Shops at the Prudential Center 800 Boylston St Boston, MA Westland Avenue Parking Garage 35 Westland A
transit: There is convenient public transportation two minutes from the door.  There are 5 busses, the Green line E train and a taxi stand.  5 minutes away you have the commuter rail, Amtrak and the Orange Line trains at Back Bay Station.
access: Private Free Wifi. In room coffee maker, small personal fridge, computer and printer for your use. Your room key gives you privacy and security. Outside your room is a large country kitchen. There is a basket of personal toiletries for those items you may have forgotten. Your room also has a hair dryer, an iron and an ironing board for your use. Extra blankets, towels and a second set of clean sheets provided.
interaction: Owner is available to answer questions and give tips on where to find and how to enjoy the Best of Boston.   A packet of Get to Know Boston materials in your  room.
house_rules: Freshly laundered slippers are provided for guests to wear in the house.  We have a no shoes policy inside the house. This is a centrally located quiet residential street of owner occupied properties.  Guest are expected to be respectful of other quests. No late night loud noise making. No smoking. Guest are expected to be respectful of other quests. No late night loud noise making. No smoking.  Freshly laundered slippers are provided for guests to wear in the house.  We have a no shoes policy inside the house. There are ample supplies: dish detergent, cloths, sponges, paper towels and cloth towels in the kitchen for guests use. Pot scrubbers are available to cleaning pots. If guests cook or use the kitchen guests are expected to wash and clean up after themselves. Plates, cups and utensils should be put back in their proper places.  There are napkins and plenty of kitchen items for guest use.
host_about: Friendly people and a great location.

space: This studio apartment in the heart of Back Bay includes; a Queen bed a small desk by the window to work at, as well as high speed internet. name: Imaginative Stay Alfred on Garrison Street
summary: Stay Alfred's latest Boston vacation rental combines the warmth and charm of nineteenth century architecture with twenty-first century amenities. At the crossroads of two historical neighborhoods, you will be a short walk from Back Bay's fashionable shops and the South End's hip restaurants and galleries.
space: Featuring a historic brick facade and wrought-iron details, the interior boasts every modern convenience, from a full kitchen to in-unit laundry. The spacious layout and stylish decor make this apartment the ideal place to recharge after a fresh seafood smorgasbord or a rousing Red Sox victory.
description: Stay Alfred's latest Boston vacation rental combines the warmth and charm of nineteenth century architecture with twenty-first century amenities. At the crossroads of two historical neighborhoods, you will be a short walk from Back Bay's fashionable shops and the South End's hip restaurants and galleries. Featuring a historic brick facade and wrought-iron details, the interior boasts every modern convenience, from a full kitchen to in-unit laundry. The spacious layout and stylish decor make this apartment the ideal place to recharge after a fresh seafood smorgasbord or a rousing Red Sox victory. Your historic Garrison Street building embodies the charm and character of Back Bay, featuring a landscaped courtyard and expansive rooftop barbecue area - perfect for grilling up something to accompany your chowdah. Your trip details should already be complete. If they aren't, give us a call ASAP so we can rectify that! What's a little information between friends?   5. Your friend, your responsibility. space: The apartment has two separate rooms divided by a common hallway (units 3 &4). One large room with a queen bed tv and couch and  bathroom, and the second room with a queen bed and open kitchen with an eating area with a TV to hook up your own AppleTV or game system.  Please understand that there is a common hallway that separates the two rooms and two separate doors. That hallway is the stairwell. Entering the bathroom will not disturb the other room and friends/family/co-workers staying there! :) Perfect for friends, co workers, or those who want to rent one apartment with two separate entrances! People that understand the layout absolutely love it! Please don't hesitate to ask more! **Please note the host reserves the right to ask for a photo ID before sending check-in instructions. No refund for lack of identification**

name: Boutique Hotel Room - Charlesmark Hotel
summary: Originally built in 1886 as a private residence in the heart of Boston's Back Bay neighborhood, the hotel has been completely renovated. Our European style boutique hotel features a hip cocktail lounge with an outdoor patio. Premier location. Exceptional value. European ambiance. The Charlesmark combines it all to create a memorable lodging experience. Ambiance - Genuine, Intimate Service **Taxes ARE included in your rate** Also Included:  * A free light Continental breakfast * Wifi
space: Our Standard Rooms feature a Full size bed. As we are located in the heart of historic boston our standard rooms are on the smaller size when compared to suburban chain hotels. Your room is located in our Boutique Hotel - every room has a custom sound system, DVD & VHS players and features our library of classic and modern movies to enjoy throughout your stay.  Just steps away from the "T" (the Boston Subway system) we are within a short walk to many historic places in Boston and a quick trip away from anywhere the city.

Along Newbury Street (one block behind our hotel), locals and visitors frequent designer boutiques, fashion chains, art galleries and patio cafes set in elegant brick townhouses.  To the front of our hotel Copley Square is flanked by 1800s landmarks Trinity Church and the Boston Public Library. Nearby mansions dot the neighborhood’s tree-lined streets, many on Paris-inspired Commonwealth Avenue.
notes: NA
transit: Just steps away from the MBTA's T (subway) "Green Line" you can get to all of boston's ground transportation within just a few minuets. If you are arriving via air, we are directly across from the Massport Logan express which runs daily trips every 20 minutes to and from Logan Airport.
access: Our bar and lounge is open from 5 to midnight or later each day. We have an attached restaurant that features authentic Italian ingredients. The restaurant is open for lunch and dinner. Our handcrafted cocktails are available in our lounge and in the attached restaurant Ora Trattorizza each evening.
interaction: We are on staff 24 hours a day to help you get the most out of your trip to Boston. Need Trolley tickets, a map, personal recommendations? We're here for you.

summary: The perfect vacation or corporate residence!  Welcome to this classy and spacious townhouse on leafy Commonwealth Avenue.   This stylish 2-bedroom, Back Bay apartment with beautiful classic details as well as a fully furnished kitchen, in-suite laundry facilities – and approved pets are welcome too!  You are close to a host of shopping, dining, entertainment and famous attractions as well as Copley Station Green Line Subway and the easy-to-ride bike lanes and Hubway bike-sharing service.

To prevent this, we kindly ask you to please place things like sanity napkins in the sanitary bin we’ve provided in the bathroom. We simply want to ensure you have a royal flush kind of holiday. 3) If you’re coming to the city to party you’ve picked a great city to do so. Unfortunately, just not at our place. Though we’re sure it won’t come to it, serious complaints of unruly behavior will unfortunately result in you being asked to leave. Not good for you, not good for us. 4) Check-in is at 3 pm, and check-out is by 11 am. Arriving slightly earlier, or want that extra hour to sleep? name: Historic Top-Floor Quiet Downtown apt. Full Sun!
summary: This top floor walk-up apartment is our home! When the sun is out, the whole apartment is full of light- 8 windows! It is a historic district and is tucked away from the busy city centers nearby. The neighborhood is quiet and surprisingly inhabited by a good number of locals. It's a special place with handmade furniture, plants and books. If you are someone looking for a transitional place that feels like home, or come to the city often for work, this place could work well. Welcome.
space: This top floor walk-up apartment is our home. When the sun is out, the whole apartment is full of light- there are 8 windows. It is a historic district and is tucked away from the busy city centers nearby. The neighborhood is quiet and surprisingly inhabited by a good number of locals. Whole Foods, Chinatown, Flour, South End restaurants, YMCA, Theater district, Newbury St., CVS, Red/Green/Orange line Trains are within three blocks of walking. We are a couple and will be traveling through the month of March this spring 2019. Our home is furnished to accomodate two single people, one person, or a couple. There are two good size bedrooms. There are two beds and linens will be made available for the time listed. The floors are hardwood. There are carpets in each room except the kitchen. Some of the furniture has been handmade and is sentimental. There is ample closet space and some extra storage we can make space for you. We have cookware, we recycle and take care to be quiet with our nei

neighborhood_overview: We have a great neighborhood breakfast spot that is also quite famous, called Mike & Patty's. A few blocks away, also a Boston staple bakery called, Flour. This area was the residential district for most of the architects who designed and built the city of Boston. It also is the birthplace of Edgar Allen Poe. You can see a statue of him on the corner of Boyleston St. and Charles St. just two blocks away. Before you get to the statue, there is also the beautiful Leica Photography Gallery, a Steinway studio showroom and other beautiful design spaces for furniture and instruments. It is within walking distance of the Castle and all of the South End Tremont Street activities and Chinatown fun. Just overall really central and yet, peaceful.
notes: NA
transit: Red/Green/Orange line Trains are within three blocks of walking. There is designated visitor parking zones right out front of our door and also the street just next to us. Taxis and car services are always quick to arrive because of the location and especially nice for day trips because the highway exit to MassPike is just around the corner.

name: Unbeatable Stay Alfred on Garrison Street
summary: Stay Alfred's latest Boston vacation rental combines the warmth and charm of nineteenth century architecture with twenty-first century amenities. At the crossroads of two historical neighborhoods, you will be a short walk from Back Bay's fashionable shops and the South End's hip restaurants and galleries.
space: Featuring a historic brick facade and wrought-iron details, the interior boasts every modern convenience, from a full kitchen to in-unit laundry. The spacious layout and stylish decor make this apartment the ideal place to recharge after a fresh seafood smorgasbord or a rousing Red Sox victory.
description: Stay Alfred's latest Boston vacation rental combines the warmth and charm of nineteenth century architecture with twenty-first century amenities. At the crossroads of two historical neighborhoods, you will be a short walk from Back Bay's fashionable shops and the South End's hip restaurants and galleries. Featuring a historic brick facade and wrought-iron details, the interior boasts every modern convenience, from a full kitchen to in-unit laundry. The spacious layout and stylish decor make this apartment the ideal place to recharge after a fresh seafood smorgasbord or a rousing Red Sox victory. Your historic Garrison Street building embodies the charm and character of Back Bay, featuring a landscaped courtyard and expansive rooftop barbecue area - perfect for grilling up something to accompany your chowdah. name: Entire Back Bay Brownstone! 2 Prime Parking Spots!
summary: Your very own Boston Brownstone, located in historic Back Bay, awaits your next trip! Bring a group as large as 11 to stay in our well appointed, 4000 sq foot home. Comfortable beds in various sizes, fully stocked kitchen for cooking, 3.5 bathrooms and not one but TWO prime parking spots are just a few of the amenities included with your next stay.
space: You'll be staying in a lived in family home. They keep a lot of personal belongings at the house so you will be sharing the house.  Large kitchen with french custom made cabinets, granite counter tops, gas stove with 6 cook tops, double oven and large refrigerator as well as wine refrigerator.  Since someone lives here too the kitchen is very well equipped - lots of flatware, pots and pans, plates, glasses, bowls, place mats, napkins, cutting boards, etc.  Large kitchen tables with seating for 6 and 3 stools at the kitchen counter.  There is a garden outside you can sit at during warmer months. TV's throughout the house with premium stations, in home washer/dryer and 2 prime parking spots included in the rent!  High quality linens, bedding and towels provided and for easier planning here is a bed layout:  2nd floor: 1 king bed 3rd floor: 1 full bed 4th floor: 2 bedrooms with queen size beds  Garden level: sleep sofa 1 twin size roll away beds
description: Your very own Boston Brownstone, located in historic Back Bay, awaits your next trip! Bring a group as large as 11 to stay in our well appointed, 4000 sq foot home. Comfortable beds in various sizes, fully stocked kitchen for cooking, 3.5 bathrooms and not one but TWO prime parking spots are just a few of the amenities included with your next stay. You'll be staying in a lived in family home. They keep a lot of personal belongings at the house so you will be sharing the house.  Large kitchen with french custom made cabinets, granite counter tops, gas stove with 6 cook tops, double oven and large refrigerator as well as wine refrigerator.  Since someone lives here too the kitchen is very well equipped - lots of flatware, pots and pans, plates, glasses, bowls, place mats, napkins, cutting boards, etc.  Large kitchen tables with seating for 6 and 3 stools at the kitchen counter.  There is a garden outside you can sit at during warmer months. TV's throughout the house with premium stations
neighborhood_overview: Walk to the left a few hundred feet and you'll hit the Charles River, walk to the right and you'll land upon Newbury Street, Boylston Street and Commonwealth Avenue which has some of the area's best restaurants, unique boutique stores, and classic Boston brownstones. You are steps away from the Boston Marathon Finish Line! Take in the views atop the Prudential Center, visit Trinity Church, or The Boston Public Library, all within a short walk of the studio.
notes: Please see house rules to make sure your group will be a good fit.  If you live locally please DO NOT instant book but contact us first.  Check-in is anytime after 4:00pm and check-out is no later than 11:00am. We have to firmly keep to these times as our housekeepers require ample time to prepare for your arrival We cannot offer space to store your bags past 11AM on your check out day or earlier than 4PM on your arrival day. We recommend using the app called StoreMe which has luggage storage all over town. Use the promo code "bnbbos" to get $3 off the first hour of your reservation. There may not be a storage solution near the property but you should be able to find them near most T stops or perhaps by your first destination! When booking, please tell us about yourself and what brings you to Boston. We ask that you have finished the Airbnb verification process by verifying one social media account and scanning your offline ID. Go to www.airbnb.com/verify for more info. Payment is due
transit: Although seeing Boston by foot, is easy in a location so central, we are located near numerous buses and trains too. We are a short 7 minute walk to the green line to catch a Sox game at Fenway, and 18 minutes to the orange line at Back Bay Station and minutes to many local buses
access: Guests will have full access to the house.
interaction: Always available 24/7 to answer questions and help in any way that we can!
house_rules: Our goal is to create a very enjoyable stay for your trip. To do that we have a few minor requests so that you are as happy as our neighbors are.  In respect to our home and our neighbors please review and accept our rental agreement:  Fines will be assessed, sometimes over your security, if you do not abide by the following rules: - Please be respectful of our neighbors by keeping noise to a normal level, reducing noise after 9:00pm, and not lingering in front of the entrance.  -All guests must be off the back patio by 8PM. Our exterior video camera may be checked to confirm this rule is being followed. Tampering with the video camera is subject to a fine.  -No additional guests without host approval  -If you live in the area, please do not instant book, contact us first.  -No parties or events. Fines assessed for additional cleaning, trash removal and property damage.  A party is grounds for termination of stay and immediate removal with no refund.  -Smoking is strictly prohibited bo
host_about:
Hi my name is Drew; I am a hospitality professional with a passion for eating, cooking, travelling and meeting new people. It brings me great pleasure to host guests in home around Boston through Airbnb. I'm great at showing guests a great and welcoming time while they visit this great City. 

If you're moving to Massachusetts, I'd love to help you find a new home to rent or own. Why not stay in one of our South End Hospitality's Airbnb properties while I show you some options? 

If you'd like to see my other listings please message me and I look forward to you staying with me.

name: 143-22 Boston Suite, Stay Tonight!
summary: Bay Village Suites welcomes you to stay in one of our recently renovated high efficiency micro-apartments. At just 180 square feet the suite is beautifully furnished and because of its size we are able to offer exceptional prices! You'll be renting a room a queen size memory foam bed in a sleeping alcove, a pull out sofa, TV for streaming, desk and for space savings no kitchen. The recently renovated bathroom is very small size with stand up shower. Photos may be of similar listing!
space: NOTE:  -There is still construction going on in the building. The crew may load in their materials as early as 7:30 but are not suppose to begin work until 8AM. They work as late as 7PM. The prices are designed to reflect this inconvenience. -Photos may be of similar listings and you agree you are booking a "like" room. This cozy micro-apartment is right in the heart of Boston. For space saving reasons your room has limited kitchen. The kitchen has a efficiency size refrigerator, toaster, microwave, and coffee pot. Please note our low introductory prices are due to the fact, that we still have some construction still going on in the building. You'll receive high quality towels and linens, shampoo and conditioner, an iron, ironing board, and a hair dryer.   Photos may be of similar listing! Do not see the dates you are looking for? Contact us anyways so I can see if I can accommodate you somewhere else!

neighborhood_overview: Your studio is located in the Bay Village neighborhood of Boston. It is nestled between Back Bay, the South End, and the Theatre District which make it the perfect spot for any traveler. Bay Village, is filled with local charm, is steps from public transportation and is near many wonderful restaurants and cafes. The street is lined with brick homes and traditional gas lamps. Although seeing Boston by foot is easy in a location so central, we are located near numerous buses and trains too. We are a 7 minute walk to the orange line at Tufts Medical Center, a short 6 minute walk to the green line to catch a Sox game at Fenway, and minutes to many local buses. Running or watching the Boston Marathon? The Boston Marathon Finish Line is just a short 12 minute walk away! Easy walk or T ride many popular destinations:  North End Freedom Trail Museum of Fine Arts, Boston Faneuil Hall Marketplace Boston Common Convenient to many colleges such as Emerson, Berkeley, BU, Boston College, UMASS, Mass
notes: When booking, please tell us about yourself and what brings you to Boston. We ask that you have finished the Airbnb verification process by verifying one social media account and scanning your offline ID. Go to www.airbnb.com/verify for more info. Smoking of any kind is forbidden in the apartment, the common areas, on the front steps of the building or within 50 feet of the building entrance.  Smokers can go to the small park at the end of the block. Photos may be of similar listing! Do not see the dates you are looking for? Prefer a private bath? Contact us anyways so I can see if I can accommodate you somewhere else!

name: 143-12 Contemporary Flat in Heart of the City!
summary: Bay Village Suites welcomes you to stay in one of our recently renovated high efficiency micro-apartments. At just 180 square feet the suite is beautifully furnished and because of its size we are able to offer exceptional prices! You'll be renting a room a queen size memory foam bed in a sleeping alcove, a pull out sofa, TV for streaming, desk and for space savings no kitchen. The recently renovated bathroom is very small size with stand up shower. Photos may be of similar listing!
space: NOTE:  -There is still construction going on in the building. The crew may load in their materials as early as 7:30 but are not suppose to begin work until 8AM. They work as late as 7PM. The prices are designed to reflect this inconvenience. -Photos may be of similar listings and you agree you are booking a "like" room. This cozy micro-apartment is right in the heart of Boston. For space saving reasons your room has limited kitchen. The kitchen has a efficiency size refrigerator, toaster, microwave, and coffee pot. Please note our low introductory prices are due to the fact, that we still have some construction still going on in the building. You'll receive high quality towels and linens, shampoo and conditioner, an iron, ironing board, and a hair dryer.   Photos may be of similar listing! Do not see the dates you are looking for? Contact us anyways so I can see if I can accommodate you somewhere else!

neighborhood_overview: Your studio is located in the Bay Village neighborhood of Boston. It is nestled between Back Bay, the South End, and the Theatre District which make it the perfect spot for any traveler. Bay Village, is filled with local charm, is steps from public transportation and is near many wonderful restaurants and cafes. The street is lined with brick homes and traditional gas lamps. Although seeing Boston by foot is easy in a location so central, we are located near numerous buses and trains too. We are a 7 minute walk to the orange line at Tufts Medical Center, a short 6 minute walk to the green line to catch a Sox game at Fenway, and minutes to many local buses. Running or watching the Boston Marathon? The Boston Marathon Finish Line is just a short 12 minute walk away! Easy walk or T ride many popular destinations:  North End Freedom Trail Museum of Fine Arts, Boston Faneuil Hall Marketplace Boston Common Convenient to many colleges such as Emerson, Berkeley, BU, Boston College, UMASS, Mass
notes: When booking, please tell us about yourself and what brings you to Boston. We ask that you have finished the Airbnb verification process by verifying one social media account and scanning your offline ID. Go to www.airbnb.com/verify for more info. Smoking of any kind is forbidden in the apartment, the common areas, on the front steps of the building or within 50 feet of the building entrance.  Smokers can go to the small park at the end of the block. Photos may be of similar listing! Do not see the dates you are looking for? Prefer a private bath? Contact us anyways so I can see if I can accommodate you somewhere else!

name: Snazzy Back Bay Studio near Boston Common & Newbury Street by Blueground
summary: Feel at home wherever you choose to live with Blueground. You’ll love this spacious Back Bay furnished studio apartment with its modern decor, fully equipped kitchen, and stylish living room with great  views. Ideally located, you’re close to all the best that Boston has to offer! (#BOS57)
space: As with any Blueground apartment, you’ll find a thoughtfully designed space complete with beautiful furniture and a fully-equipped kitchen in this studio property. And, thanks to our superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and towels, you can relax knowing you’ll always feel comfortably at home. When you’re ready for some fun, you can take in the Boston vibes or bring the entertainment to you with the premium wireless speaker or smart TV.  Amenities Building amenities unique to this studio apartment include an on-site:    - In-Building Laundry

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is situated in Back Bay in the heart of Boston, proximate to Charles River, Public Garden, and Boston Common. The neighborhood stands out through the combination of options it offers. Housing many of the cities most well-known office towers, it also offers a wide variety of shopping and dining options. During weekends, established professionals and graduate students, living in the area, head to Newbury Street for upscale shopping and a stroll along the Commonwealth Avenue Mall. The neighborhood is ideal for active, outdoor lovers, as it is only minutes away from the Esplanade and offers ample green space for jogging and biking. North and South Stations are easily accessible by car and public transit, as is the financial district.
notes: This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
transit: NA
access: NA
interaction: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
house_rules: - Building amenities may have an extra cost - A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled - Same day check-ins are only guaranteed if booking is made before 4 pm - Blueground has the right to enter and inspect the apartment or to show the apartment to a potential tenant any day of the week between 9am and 6pm as long as the tenant has been informed via email at least one day in advance - Please contact us for details
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
Blueground is changing the way the world experiences furnished living.

We take perfectly located apartments and turn them into beautifully-designed and thoughtfully-equipped homes available for stays of 30 days or longer. 

Each Blueground property comes with modern furniture, premium linens, high-speed WiFi, and everything else you need to get up and running from day one.

All backed by our dedicated, on-the-ground support team, Blueground makes finding a new place to call home frictionless. Show up and start living with Blueground today.

Founded in 2013, Blueground is currently present in nine cities around the world and has a portfolio of more than 1500 premium properties... and growing.

name: 5-44 Micro-Apartment at Boston!
summary: Bay Village Suites is happy to offer 36 high-efficiency rooms with shared bathrooms. All rooms are furnished with high-quality furniture and modern amenities, designed for the modern traveler. This micro-apartment is just 90 square feet and is furnished with a twin size memory foam bed, TV for streaming, high-speed internet with wifi connectivity, a desk, and storage space. There is no kitchen but has a efficiency size refrigerator, toaster, microwave, and coffee pot.
space: NOTE:  *There is still some construction going on in the building. The crew may load in their materials as early as 7:30 but are not suppose to begin work until 8AM. They work as late as 7PM. Please keep this in mind before booking. The prices are designed to reflect this inconvenience.* *None of our 36 rooms have private bathrooms. Most bathrooms are in the hallway and are shared among 3-4 other rooms. Only one person can be in the bathroom at a time so it's not exactly communal but definitely not private to just you. Each bathroom is shared with about 4 guests.  *Photos may be of similar listings and you agree you are booking a "like" room License #LB-101773 The space Embrace urban living in one of our recently renovated, high efficiency micro-apartments, and reap in the cost savings benefits of communal living by sharing a fully renovated bathroom with other tenants and Airbnb guests. No access to a kitchen but is steps away from the best restaurants and cafes in Boston. Please note

Easy walk or T ride many popular destinations:  North End Freedom Trail Museum of Fine Arts, Boston Faneuil Hall Marketplace Boston Common Convenient to many colleges such as Emerson, Berkeley, BU, Boston College, UMASS, Mass College of Pharmacy, Suffolk, MIT, Harvard, Tufts, Tufts Dental, and more!
notes: When booking, please tell us about yourself and what brings you to Boston. We ask that you have finished the Airbnb verification process by verifying one social media account and scanning your offline ID. Go to www.airbnb.com/verify for more info. Smoking of any kind is forbidden in the apartment, the common areas, on the front steps of the building or within 50 feet of the building entrance.  Smokers can go to the small park at the end of the block. Heat is building controlled, some rooms are warmer than others. No refunds given for heat related issues.  Photos may be of similar listing! Do not see the dates you are looking for? Prefer a private bath? Contact me anyways so I can see if I can accommodate you somewhere else!

neighborhood_overview: Your studio is located in the Bay Village neighborhood of Boston. It is nestled between Back Bay, the South End, and the Theatre District which make it the perfect spot for any traveler. Bay Village, is filled with local charm, is steps from public transportation and is near many wonderful restaurants and cafes. The street is lined with brick homes and traditional gas lamps. Although seeing Boston by foot is easy in a location so central, we are located near numerous buses and trains too. We are a 7 minute walk to the orange line at Tufts Medical Center, a short 6 minute walk to the green line to catch a Sox game at Fenway, and minutes to many local buses. Running or watching the Boston Marathon? The Boston Marathon Finish Line is just a short 12 minute walk away! Easy walk or T ride many popular destinations:  North End Freedom Trail Museum of Fine Arts, Boston Faneuil Hall Marketplace Boston Common Convenient to many colleges such as Emerson, Berkeley, BU, Boston College, UMASS, Mass

host_about:
We are a passionate team running a modern tech-enabled corp housing co that believes nicely furnished high end homes should be consistent, affordable and easy to book. 

All our homes are professionally managed, meeting the mark on being clean, well-stocked, having a more or less consistent look and feel, priced below a comparable hotel for an extended stay, and 24/7 SMS support by a virtual concierge team.

name: Chic Downtown All Brand New in Amazing Spot
summary: Chic apartment in an AMAZING location!  I am literally down the street from: the Prudential Tower, Berklee College of Music, Newbury St shops, & the Boston Symphony Orchestra. My apartment has two bedrooms w/ Queen beds, brand new stainless steel appliances, completely renovated unit - it's beautiful! host_about:
We have fallen in love with New England - we love the history and the variety of things to do and see.

My wife and I are originally from the West so being able to drive one hour and see Plymouth Rock, or Providence, RI has totally changed us.  We love to spend weekends exploring and adventuring with our kids.  We just returned from our biggest family trip yet - Singapore, Thailand, Cambodia, South Korea, and Vietnam for 3.5 months - it was amazing.

We would love to have you stay at our place!
